summary.en: “P.E.” most commonly means “physical education,” the school class for sports and exercise; it can also mean other things depending on context.
summary.zh: “P.E.”最常见指“体育课”，也可能在不同语境下代表其他含义。

definition.en: Physical education; a school subject and class that focuses on exercise, sports, and learning healthy movement.
definition.zh: 体育课；学校里以运动、体育活动和健康体能为核心的课程。

examples.en: We have P.E. twice a week.
examples.zh: 我们一周上两次体育课。

examples.en: In P.E., we learned how to warm up safely before running.
examples.zh: 在体育课上，我们学习了跑步前如何安全热身。

examples.en: She forgot her sneakers, so she couldn’t fully join P.E. today.
examples.zh: 她忘带运动鞋了，所以今天没法完全参加体育课。

definition.en: An abbreviation for other terms depending on context (for example, “Professional Engineer” in the U.S.).
definition.zh: 在不同语境下可代表其他含义的缩写（例如在美国可指“注册工程师/专业工程师”Professional Engineer）。

examples.en: He signed the report as a P.E. because he is a licensed engineer.
examples.zh: 他以P.E.的身份在报告上签名，因为他是持证工程师。

extraExplanation: 在学校语境里，P.E.常写作“PE”或“P.E.”，口语里也常直接说“pee-ee”。英式英语也常说“PE”，含义基本相同。
如果你是在考试、医学、工程或社交媒体里看到“PE”，它还可能代表很多别的缩写（如“pulmonary embolism 肺栓塞”“price-to-earnings ratio 市盈率”）。给我一句原文我可以帮你判断具体意思。

summary.en: “PE” most commonly means physical education (gym class). It can also mean the P/E ratio in finance or polyethylene in materials.
summary.zh: “PE”最常见意思是体育课（gym class）。它也可指金融中的市盈率（P/E）或材料中的聚乙烯（PE）。

definition.en: physical education; a school subject that teaches sports, exercise, and health-related fitness (often called “gym” in the U.S.).
definition.zh: 体育课；学校里教授运动、锻炼与健康体能的课程（在美国也常叫“gym”）。

examples.en: We have PE on Tuesdays and Thursdays.
examples.zh: 我们周二和周四有体育课。

examples.en: I forgot my PE uniform, so I couldn’t join the class.
examples.zh: 我忘了带体育课服装，所以没法参加上课。

examples.en: PE helps students stay active and learn teamwork.
examples.zh: 体育课帮助学生保持活跃并学习团队合作。

definition.en: (finance) price-to-earnings ratio; a number used to compare a company’s share price with its earnings (usually written “P/E”).
definition.zh: （金融）市盈率；用来比较公司股价与盈利的指标（常写作“P/E”）。

examples.en: This stock has a high P/E ratio.
examples.zh: 这只股票的市盈率很高。

examples.en: Investors often compare P/E ratios across companies in the same industry.
examples.zh: 投资者常把同一行业公司的市盈率进行比较。

definition.en: (materials) polyethylene; a common plastic used in bags, bottles, and packaging (often written “PE”).
definition.zh: （材料）聚乙烯；一种常见塑料，用于塑料袋、瓶子和包装（常写作“PE”）。

examples.en: The label says the package is made of PE.
examples.zh: 标签上写着包装是由PE（聚乙烯）制成的。

examples.en: PE plastic is widely used because it’s cheap and durable.
examples.zh: PE塑料因价格低且耐用而被广泛使用。

extraExplanation: “PE”通常是字母缩写，读作 /ˌpiˈi/，在书面语中也常写成“P.E.”（带点）或“PE”（不带点）；两种写法都常见。
在美国校园语境里，学生更常说“gym”或“gym class”来指体育课；在更正式的文件或课程表中常写“PE/Physical Education”。
金融语境中更常写作“P/E ratio”，材料与回收标识语境中常见“PE”（聚乙烯）。

summary.en: A pea is a small round green seed eaten as a vegetable; it can also mean to remove peas from their pods.
summary.zh: pea 指“豌豆”；也可作动词，表示“剥豌豆（从豆荚里取出）”。

definition.en: a small, round green seed that is eaten as a vegetable, often from a pod (the shell).
definition.zh: 豌豆：一种小而圆的绿色种子，常从豆荚里取出食用，属于蔬菜类。

examples.en: I like peas with butter and a little salt.
examples.zh: 我喜欢豌豆加黄油和一点盐。

examples.en: She added peas to the soup.
examples.zh: 她在汤里加了豌豆。

examples.en: Fresh peas come in pods.
examples.zh: 新鲜豌豆长在豆荚里。

definition.en: to remove peas from their pods (to shell peas).
definition.zh: 剥豌豆：把豌豆从豆荚里剥出来。

examples.en: We sat outside and pead a whole bowl of peas for dinner.
examples.zh: 我们坐在外面剥了一大碗豌豆准备晚饭。

extraExplanation: 在美式英语里，复数 peas 更常见，因为通常是一颗颗来数；也常见作不可数食物概念（如“peas and carrots”豌豆胡萝卜）。
“pea”也常出现在比喻里，强调“非常小”：例如 like a pea（像豌豆一样小）或 as alike as two peas in a pod（像一个豆荚里的两颗豌豆一样相像）。

summary.en: A pea is a small round seed eaten as a vegetable, or the plant that produces it; it can also mean something very small (pea-sized).
summary.zh: pea 指可食用的豌豆豆粒或豌豆植株；也可引申表示“很小的东西/量”（如 pea-sized）。

definition.en: A small, round green seed eaten as a vegetable, usually from a pod.
definition.zh: 豌豆；一种长在豆荚里、常作为蔬菜食用的小而圆的绿色豆粒。

examples.en: We had peas with dinner.
examples.zh: 我们晚餐配了豌豆。

examples.en: She added peas to the soup.
examples.zh: 她在汤里加了豌豆。

definition.en: A plant that produces peas, often grown in gardens or farms.
definition.zh: 豌豆植株；结豌豆的植物，常在菜园或农场种植。

examples.en: Peas grow well in cool weather.
examples.zh: 豌豆在凉爽的天气里长得很好。

examples.en: He planted peas in early spring.
examples.zh: 他在早春种了豌豆。

definition.en: A very small amount or piece (often in the phrase “a pea-sized”).
definition.zh: 极小的量/颗粒（常用于短语“pea-sized”表示“豌豆大小的”）。

examples.en: Use a pea-sized amount of toothpaste.
examples.zh: 用豌豆大小的一点牙膏就够了。

examples.en: There was a pea-sized hole in the fabric.
examples.zh: 布料上有一个豌豆大小的小洞。

extraExplanation: “pea”常见搭配：green peas（青豌豆）、split peas（去皮对半的干豌豆，常用于浓汤）、snow peas（荷兰豆/雪豆，扁平可连荚吃）、sugar snap peas（甜脆豌豆，荚更厚更脆）。
文化小知识：英语里常用豌豆来形容“很小”，例如“pea-sized”。另外，童谣《Pease Porridge Hot》里的“pease”是“peas”的古老拼写，指豌豆粥。

summary.en: “Peace” most commonly means no war/violence, and it can also mean inner calm or an agreement to end conflict.
summary.zh: “Peace”最常指没有战争或暴力的和平，也可指内心的平静，或结束冲突的协议/状态。

definition.en: a state in which there is no war or violence; public safety and order
definition.zh: 和平；（社会）安宁、治安良好

examples.en: After years of fighting, the two countries finally made peace.
examples.zh: 多年交战后，两国终于实现了和平。

examples.en: The police worked to keep the peace during the large protest.
examples.zh: 警方在大型抗议活动中努力维持秩序。

definition.en: a calm, quiet feeling; freedom from worry or stress
definition.zh: 内心的平静；安心；无忧无虑

examples.en: I feel peace when I walk by the ocean.
examples.zh: 我在海边散步时会感到内心很平静。

examples.en: She found peace of mind after talking to a counselor.
examples.zh: 和咨询师聊过之后，她获得了安心。

definition.en: an agreement to end a conflict; a period when conflict has stopped
definition.zh: 和解；停战协议；和平时期

examples.en: The leaders signed a peace agreement.
examples.zh: 领导人签署了和平协议。

examples.en: The ceasefire brought a short peace to the region.
examples.zh: 停火让该地区短暂恢复了平静。

definition.en: (informal) used as a friendly goodbye or a wish for calm and goodwill
definition.zh: （非正式）用于道别或表达祝愿：愿你平安/保持友好

examples.en: Peace, see you tomorrow!
examples.zh: 平安/保重，明天见！

examples.en: He ended the call with, “Peace.”
examples.zh: 他在电话结尾说了句“Peace（保重/和平）”。

extraExplanation: “peace of mind”很常用，强调“心里踏实、安心”，不一定指外部没有冲突。
“keep the peace”常见于新闻或正式语境，指“维持秩序/防止冲突升级”。
流行文化里“Peace!”常作为随意的告别语；手势“V”在某些文化中也常与“peace（和平）”联系在一起。

summary.en: Peace means no war or conflict, and it can also mean a calm, quiet feeling in your mind.
summary.zh: peace 指没有战争或冲突的“和平”，也可指内心安宁、平静的感觉。

definition.en: A state of calm and safety with no war, violence, or serious conflict.
definition.zh: 和平；无战争、无暴力冲突的状态。

examples.en: The two countries signed an agreement to keep the peace.
examples.zh: 两国签署协议以维护和平。

examples.en: After years of war, people hoped for peace.
examples.zh: 经历多年战争后，人们渴望和平。

definition.en: A calm, quiet feeling in your mind; freedom from worry or stress.
definition.zh: 内心的平静；安宁；不焦虑、不烦恼的状态。

examples.en: I feel at peace when I walk by the ocean.
examples.zh: 在海边散步时，我感到内心很平静。

examples.en: Meditation can bring peace of mind.
examples.zh: 冥想能带来心灵的安宁。

definition.en: A situation of public order and safety, without fighting or disorder (often in the phrase “keep the peace”).
definition.zh: 治安与秩序；社会安宁（常见于短语“keep the peace”维持秩序）。

examples.en: Extra police were sent to keep the peace during the parade.
examples.zh: 游行期间增派警力以维持秩序。

definition.en: Used as a friendly way to ask for quiet or stop an argument.
definition.zh: （感叹）用于友好地请人安静或停止争吵。

examples.en: Peace, everyone—let’s talk one at a time.
examples.zh: 大家安静一下——我们一个一个说。

extraExplanation: “peace”来自拉丁语“pax”，与“pacify（安抚）”“Pacific（太平洋；和平的）”同源，核心感觉是“让冲突停止、让人安稳”。
常见搭配：peace and quiet（清静）、at peace（内心平静/不再痛苦）、make peace (with)（与……和解）、peace talks（和谈）、a peace treaty（和平条约）。
文学与文化中常用“peace”表达一种理想状态，例如《圣经》中常见的“peace be with you”（愿你平安），现代英语里也常用来表达祝愿与安好。

summary.en: Peaceful means calm and quiet, or non-violent and free from conflict.
summary.zh: peaceful 表示“平静安宁的”，也可指“和平的、非暴力的、无冲突的”。

definition.en: Calm and quiet; not disturbed by noise, violence, or strong conflict.
definition.zh: 平静的；安宁的；没有噪音、暴力或强烈冲突的。

examples.en: It’s a peaceful neighborhood with lots of trees.
examples.zh: 这是一个很安宁的社区，树木很多。

examples.en: After a long day, I like to take a peaceful walk by the river.
examples.zh: 忙了一整天后，我喜欢在河边安静地散步。

examples.en: They hoped for a peaceful solution to the disagreement.
examples.zh: 他们希望用和平的方式解决分歧。

definition.en: Not taking part in war or violence; preferring non-violent ways (often about a person, group, or protest).
definition.zh: 不诉诸战争或暴力的；主张非暴力的（常指人、团体或抗议）。

examples.en: The protesters remained peaceful throughout the march.
examples.zh: 抗议者在整个游行过程中都保持和平、克制。

examples.en: She is a peaceful person who avoids fighting.
examples.zh: 她是个温和的人，尽量避免冲突。

extraExplanation: “peaceful”通常描述一种“外在环境的宁静”（peaceful place/scene）或“处理方式的非暴力”（peaceful protest/peaceful resolution）。
常见搭配：peaceful morning（宁静的早晨）, peaceful sleep（安稳的睡眠）, peaceful coexistence（和平共处）, peaceful transfer of power（和平交接权力）。
词源上与peace（和平）同源，-ful表示“充满……的”。注意与“pacific”区分：pacific更偏书面/正式，常用于“温和的、平息冲突的”，如pacific attitude。

summary.en: “Peacefully” means calmly and quietly, or without conflict or violence.
summary.zh: “peacefully”表示“平静安宁地”，也可指“没有冲突、没有暴力地（和平地）”。

definition.en: In a calm, quiet way, without disturbance or violence.
definition.zh: 平静地；安宁地；没有骚乱或暴力地。

examples.en: The baby slept peacefully through the night.
examples.zh: 宝宝整晚都睡得很安稳。

examples.en: They protested peacefully in the city center.
examples.zh: 他们在市中心进行了和平的抗议。

examples.en: She passed away peacefully at home.
examples.zh: 她在家里安详地离世。

definition.en: In a friendly way, without arguing or conflict.
definition.zh: 和睦地；不争吵地；没有冲突地。

examples.en: The neighbors learned to live peacefully with each other.
examples.zh: 邻居们学会了彼此和睦相处。

examples.en: We solved the problem peacefully, without blaming anyone.
examples.zh: 我们和平地解决了问题，没有责怪任何人。

extraExplanation: “peacefully”来自名词 peace（和平、安宁）+ 副词后缀 -fully，表示“以……的方式”。常与 sleep / protest / live / die 等动词搭配。
表达“安详离世”时，英语里常用 pass away peacefully（较委婉、尊重的说法）；语境较正式或有同情意味。

summary.en: Peacefulness means a calm, quiet feeling or atmosphere, with little stress or disturbance.
summary.zh: Peacefulness 指一种平静、安宁的感觉或氛围，压力与打扰很少。

definition.en: A calm, quiet state of mind or feeling, with little worry or stress; inner peace.
definition.zh: 一种平静、安宁的心理或感受状态；内心的平和。

examples.en: Meditation helps me find peacefulness when I feel stressed.
examples.zh: 当我感到压力大时，冥想能帮助我找到内心的平静。

examples.en: There was a sense of peacefulness in the room after the argument ended.
examples.zh: 争吵结束后，房间里有一种安宁的感觉。

definition.en: The quality of a place or situation being quiet, calm, and free from disturbance.
definition.zh: 环境或情境安静、祥和、不受打扰的特质。

examples.en: We loved the peacefulness of the countryside at night.
examples.zh: 我们很喜欢夜晚乡村的宁静。

examples.en: The library’s peacefulness makes it a good place to study.
examples.zh: 图书馆的安静氛围让它成为学习的好地方。

extraExplanation: “peacefulness”来自形容词“peaceful（平静的）”加名词后缀“-ness”，表示“……的状态/性质”。它比“peace”更偏向“安宁的感觉或氛围”，而“peace”既可指内心平和，也常指“和平（没有战争/冲突）”。
常见搭配：a sense of peacefulness（宁静感）；find peacefulness（找到平静）；the peacefulness of + 地点（某地的宁静）。

summary.en: A peacekeeper is someone (often a UN force) who works to prevent conflict and maintain peace; it can also mean a person who calms disputes in daily life.
summary.zh: peacekeeper 指维持和平、阻止冲突的人（常指联合国维和人员/部队）；也可指日常生活中负责调解争端的和事佬。

definition.en: a person, group, or military force that works to prevent fighting and keep peace, especially in areas of conflict
definition.zh: 维和者；维和部队：为防止冲突、维持和平而行动的人、团体或军事力量，尤指在冲突地区

examples.en: UN peacekeepers were sent to monitor the ceasefire.
examples.zh: 联合国维和人员被派去监督停火。

examples.en: The village leaders acted as peacekeepers during the dispute.
examples.zh: 村里的领导在争端中充当了调解维和的角色。

definition.en: someone who calms arguments or stops trouble in everyday situations
definition.zh: （日常生活中的）劝架者；调停者：在争吵或骚乱中安抚局势、阻止事态升级的人

examples.en: She tried to be a peacekeeper between her two friends.
examples.zh: 她努力在两位朋友之间当和事佬。

examples.en: He’s the peacekeeper in the family when tempers rise.
examples.zh: 家里一有人发火，他就是那个负责降温的人。

extraExplanation: “peacekeeper”常见于新闻与国际政治语境，尤其与联合国（UN）相关：如“UN peacekeeping mission（联合国维和任务）”。维和行动通常包括监督停火、保护平民、协助人道救援等，但是否“能使用武力”取决于任务授权与规则（rules of engagement）。
词形上是 peace + keeper（维护和平的人）。在日常语境里，它也可指性格或角色上“爱调解、避免冲突的人”，语气通常是正面的。

summary.en: Peacekeeping means actions—often by international forces—to maintain or restore peace, especially after conflict.
summary.zh: peacekeeping 指维和行动：常由国际力量在冲突后维持或恢复和平。

definition.en: The activity of maintaining or restoring peace and order, especially by international forces in areas of conflict.
definition.zh: 维和；（尤指）由国际部队在冲突地区维持或恢复和平与秩序的行动。

examples.en: The UN sent troops for peacekeeping after the ceasefire.
examples.zh: 停火后，联合国派遣部队执行维和任务。

examples.en: Peacekeeping missions often work with local communities to reduce violence.
examples.zh: 维和行动常与当地社区合作以减少暴力。

examples.en: She studied how peacekeeping affects civilians in post-war countries.
examples.zh: 她研究维和行动如何影响战后国家的平民。

definition.en: Relating to efforts to keep peace, especially by neutral forces or organizations.
definition.zh: 维和的；与维持和平相关的（尤指由中立部队或组织开展的）。

examples.en: They provided peacekeeping support, including medical aid.
examples.zh: 他们提供维和支持，包括医疗援助。

examples.en: The region needs peacekeeping measures to prevent renewed fighting.
examples.zh: 该地区需要维和措施以防止战火再起。

extraExplanation: “peacekeeping”常见于新闻与国际关系语境，多指联合国等机构的“维和行动/维和任务”（peacekeeping mission/operation）。通常发生在冲突各方已同意停火之后，维和人员往往被期望保持中立、保护平民、协助执行停火与人道援助。
常见搭配：peacekeeping forces（维和部队）、peacekeeping mission/operation（维和任务/行动）、peacekeeper（维和人员）。与“peace enforcement（强制和平）”不同，后者通常更强调用武力迫使停止冲突，语气更强硬。

summary.en: A peacemaker is someone (or sometimes an organization) who helps end conflict and bring people to agreement; it can also refer to a famous type of handgun.
summary.zh: peacemaker 指帮助化解冲突、促成和解的人（或组织）；也可指一种著名手枪的称呼/型号名。

definition.en: A person who helps stop arguments or conflict and brings people to agreement.
definition.zh: 调解者；和事佬：帮助停止争吵或冲突、促成和解的人。

examples.en: When the discussion got heated, Maya stepped in as a peacemaker.
examples.zh: 讨论变得激烈时，Maya 站出来当和事佬。

examples.en: The teacher asked two students to act as peacemakers during group work.
examples.zh: 老师让两名学生在小组活动中充当调解者。

examples.en: He’s a natural peacemaker who listens to both sides before speaking.
examples.zh: 他天生就擅长调解，会先听双方说完再开口。

definition.en: A government leader, diplomat, or organization that works to end war or violence between groups or countries.
definition.zh: 和平推动者；斡旋方：致力于结束国家或群体间战争与暴力的领导人、外交官或组织。

examples.en: The UN often serves as a peacemaker in international disputes.
examples.zh: 联合国常在国际争端中扮演斡旋和平的角色。

examples.en: The agreement succeeded because a trusted peacemaker stayed involved.
examples.zh: 协议之所以成功，是因为一位受信任的调停者持续介入。

definition.en: A type of handgun (especially the Colt “Peacemaker”), used as a nickname or brand name.
definition.zh: （尤指柯尔特“和平使者”）一种手枪的绰号或型号名。

examples.en: In old Western movies, the cowboy’s peacemaker is often a Colt revolver.
examples.zh: 在老西部片里，牛仔的“peacemaker”常指柯尔特左轮手枪。

extraExplanation: “peacemaker”由 peace（和平）+ maker（促成者）组成，常见于学校、家庭与职场语境，强调通过倾听与沟通来“促成和平”。
注意它也有美国文化里的“西部片”含义：把手枪称为“Peacemaker”带有讽刺意味（用武力“带来和平”），常见于历史与影视语境。

summary.en: Peacetime means a period without war, and it can also describe things related to that period.
summary.zh: Peacetime 指没有战争的时期，也可作形容词表示“和平时期的、与非战时相关的”。

definition.en: A period when a country is not at war; a time of peace.
definition.zh: 和平时期；国家未处于战争状态的时间。

examples.en: During peacetime, the army focuses more on training and disaster relief.
examples.zh: 在和平时期，军队更多侧重训练和救灾。

examples.en: The company shifted from making military supplies in wartime to consumer goods in peacetime.
examples.zh: 这家公司在战时生产军需品，到了和平时期转而生产民用产品。

definition.en: Happening in or related to a period without war.
definition.zh: 和平时期的；与非战争时期相关的。

examples.en: Peacetime budgets are usually smaller than wartime budgets.
examples.zh: 和平时期的预算通常比战时预算更小。

examples.en: The country maintained a large peacetime military.
examples.zh: 该国在和平时期仍维持一支规模较大的军队。

synonyms: postwar (sometimes, but not always the same)
extraExplanation: “peacetime”是复合词（peace + time），常与“wartime（战时）”形成对比。写作与新闻中很常见，用来强调政策、经济或社会在“非战争”背景下的状态。

summary.en: Peacetime means the period when a country is not at war.
summary.zh: Peacetime 指国家处于非战争状态的和平时期。

definition.en: A period when a country is not at war; a time of peace.
definition.zh: 和平时期；没有战争的时期。

examples.en: The country reduced military spending in peacetime.
examples.zh: 在和平时期，这个国家减少了军费开支。

examples.en: Some laws apply only during wartime, not peacetime.
examples.zh: 有些法律只在战时适用，而不适用于和平时期。

extraExplanation: “peacetime”常用于与“wartime（战时）”对比的正式语境，比如政府政策、经济、军队与法律。它强调“没有战争状态”，但不一定意味着社会完全没有冲突或问题。
常见搭配：peacetime economy（和平时期经济）、peacetime production（和平时期生产）、in peacetime（在和平时期）。

summary.en: Peach means the fuzzy stone fruit, and it can also mean a pale pink-orange color (and an adjective for that color).
summary.zh: peach 指“桃子”，也可指“桃色”（一种粉橘色），并可作形容词表示这种颜色。

definition.en: A round, soft fruit with fuzzy skin, usually yellow-orange with a pink/red blush, and a large pit (stone) inside.
definition.zh: 桃子；一种圆形柔软的水果，表皮有细绒毛，通常黄橙色带红晕，里面有大核（果核）。

examples.en: I bought some fresh peaches at the farmers’ market.
examples.zh: 我在农夫市集买了一些新鲜桃子。

examples.en: This peach is sweet and very juicy.
examples.zh: 这个桃子很甜，而且汁很多。

examples.en: Peach slices go well in yogurt or oatmeal.
examples.zh: 桃子片很适合配酸奶或燕麦。

definition.en: A pale pinkish-orange color, like the color of a peach.
definition.zh: 桃色；一种淡淡的粉橘色，像桃子的颜色。

examples.en: She painted the bedroom a soft peach color.
examples.zh: 她把卧室刷成了柔和的桃色。

examples.en: The sky turned peach at sunset.
examples.zh: 日落时天空变成了桃色。

definition.en: Relating to or colored like a peach.
definition.zh: 桃色的；像桃子颜色的。

examples.en: He wore a peach shirt to the party.
examples.zh: 他穿了一件桃色衬衫去参加派对。

examples.en: Her cheeks looked peach in the warm light.
examples.zh: 在温暖的灯光下，她的脸颊呈现桃色。

extraExplanation: 在口语里，peach 有时可用来夸人“很棒、很可爱”（如 “You’re a peach.”），语气通常亲切但略带老派。使用时注意场合与关系亲疏。
文化补充：在美国南方，乔治亚州（Georgia）常被称为 “the Peach State（桃子州）”，桃子也常出现在当地的甜点与饮食文化里（如 peach cobbler）。

summary.en: Peaches are sweet fuzzy fruits; the word can also mean the peach tree, a peach-like color, or (informally) a very nice person.
summary.zh: peaches 指“桃子”；也可指桃树、桃色，或（口语）很讨人喜欢的人。

definition.en: A round, sweet, juicy fruit with fuzzy skin and a large pit (stone) inside.
definition.zh: 桃子：一种圆形、甜多汁、表皮有细绒毛，里面有大核的水果。

examples.en: These peaches are ripe and very sweet.
examples.zh: 这些桃子熟了，很甜。

examples.en: She made a peach pie for dessert.
examples.zh: 她做了桃子派当甜点。

examples.en: Cut the peach in half and remove the pit.
examples.zh: 把桃子切成两半，把核去掉。

definition.en: The tree that produces peaches.
definition.zh: 桃树：结桃子的树。

examples.en: A peach tree grows best in full sun.
examples.zh: 桃树在充足阳光下长得最好。

examples.en: We planted a peach tree in the backyard.
examples.zh: 我们在后院种了一棵桃树。

definition.en: A pinkish-yellow color like the skin of a peach.
definition.zh: 桃色：像桃子表皮那样的粉橘色/粉黄色。

examples.en: She chose a peach dress for the party.
examples.zh: 她选了一条桃色的裙子去参加聚会。

examples.en: The walls are painted a soft peach color.
examples.zh: 墙刷成了柔和的桃色。

definition.en: (Informal) A person who is especially pleasant, kind, or attractive.
definition.zh: （非正式）讨人喜欢的人；很棒的人（有时也指长得好看）。

examples.en: Thanks for helping me—you’re a real peach.
examples.zh: 谢谢你帮我——你真是个大好人。

examples.en: Our neighbor is a peach; she always checks on us.
examples.zh: 我们的邻居人很好；她总是关心我们。

extraExplanation: 在美国文化里，“Georgia is the Peach State（佐治亚州是桃子州）”很常见，因为佐治亚以桃子种植与相关产品闻名。
“You’re a peach”属于口语夸奖，语气友好但偏老派；在正式场合一般不用。

summary.en: “Peachy” means (1) a healthy peach-like color, and (2) informally, very good—often in “just peachy,” sometimes sarcastically.
summary.zh: “Peachy”可指（1）像桃子一样红润健康的气色；（2）口语中指“很好/不错”，常见于“just peachy”，有时带反讽。

definition.en: Having a healthy, pleasant color (like the pink-orange of a peach), especially describing skin or complexion.
definition.zh: （肤色等）红润健康的，带桃色光泽的。

examples.en: You look peachy today—did you get more sleep?
examples.zh: 你今天看起来气色很红润——是不是睡得更好了？

examples.en: She had a peachy glow after the walk outside.
examples.zh: 她在外面散步后脸上有种红润的光泽。

definition.en: (Informal) Very good; fine; going well. Often used in the phrase “just peachy.”
definition.zh: （非正式）很好；不错；进展顺利。常用于短语“just peachy”（很好/挺不错）。

examples.en: Everything’s peachy now that the deadline is extended.
examples.zh: 截止日期延后了，现在一切都挺顺利。

examples.en: “How are you?” “Just peachy.”
examples.zh: “你怎么样？”“挺好的。”

examples.en: He said it was “just peachy,” but his tone sounded sarcastic.
examples.zh: 他说“挺好的”，但语气听起来有点讽刺。

extraExplanation: “peachy”字面来自水果peach（桃子）的颜色与“甜美、讨喜”的联想，所以既能形容肤色，也能引申为“很好”。
口语里“just peachy”有时会带反讽：表面说“很好”，实际可能是在抱怨或不开心；要结合语气和语境判断。

summary.en: A peacock is a colorful male peafowl, and it can also mean someone who likes to show off.
summary.zh: peacock 指雄孔雀；也可比喻爱炫耀、爱出风头的人。

definition.en: A large bird (male peafowl) known for its bright blue-green feathers and a long, colorful tail that it can spread out like a fan.
definition.zh: 孔雀（雄孔雀/雄孔雀鸟）：一种大型鸟类，以蓝绿色羽毛和可展开成扇形的绚丽长尾著称。

examples.en: The peacock spread its tail feathers to attract a mate.
examples.zh: 孔雀展开尾羽来吸引配偶。

examples.en: We saw a peacock walking proudly in the garden.
examples.zh: 我们看到一只孔雀在花园里神气地走着。

examples.en: The children were amazed by the peacock’s colorful display.
examples.zh: 孩子们对孔雀五彩斑斓的开屏表演感到惊叹。

definition.en: A man who likes to show off, especially by dressing in a flashy way or acting proudly.
definition.zh: 爱炫耀的人（尤指穿得花哨、举止自负的男人）。

examples.en: He’s a bit of a peacock—always wearing bright suits and talking about himself.
examples.zh: 他有点爱显摆——总穿着鲜艳的西装，还总爱谈自己。

examples.en: She joked that her brother turns into a peacock at parties.
examples.zh: 她开玩笑说她哥哥一到派对就变成“孔雀”一样爱出风头。

extraExplanation: 在英语里，严格来说“peacock”多指雄性；雌性常叫“peahen”，统称为“peafowl”。日常口语中，人们也常用“peacock”泛指孔雀。
“proud as a peacock”（像孔雀一样骄傲）是常见表达，用来形容一个人很得意、很自豪。
孔雀在很多文化中象征美丽、华丽与自尊；在文学或描写中常用来营造“炫目、张扬”的意象。

summary.en: “Peacocked” means “showed off” or “strutted,” often in an attention-seeking way.
summary.zh: “peacocked”表示“炫耀/招摇/趾高气扬”，常带有想引人注意的意味。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle of “peacock”) To show off in a proud, attention-seeking way; to strut.
definition.zh: （“peacock”的过去式/过去分词）以炫耀的方式招摇、趾高气扬地走；显摆。

examples.en: He peacocked around the office after getting the promotion.
examples.zh: 他升职后在办公室里到处招摇显摆。

examples.en: She peacocked in her new coat, hoping everyone would notice.
examples.zh: 她穿着新外套炫耀，希望大家都能注意到。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle of “peacock”) To display something proudly or flamboyantly, as if showing off feathers.
definition.zh: （“peacock”的过去式/过去分词）夸张地展示（某物）；得意地炫示。

examples.en: He peacocked his new watch at dinner.
examples.zh: 他在晚餐时得意地炫耀他的新手表。

examples.en: The brand peacocked its logo on every surface.
examples.zh: 这个品牌把标志夸张地印在几乎每个表面上。

extraExplanation: “peacock”作动词是比喻用法，来自孔雀开屏吸引注意：含义通常偏负面，暗示自我炫耀、想博眼球。
形式上“peacocked”常见于叙述语境（过去发生的动作）或被动语态（如：The logo was peacocked everywhere）。日常口语里也常用更常见的表达：showed off / strutted / flaunted。

summary.en: Peacocking means showing off in a flashy way to get attention, often in social or dating situations.
summary.zh: Peacocking 指用张扬的方式炫耀以吸引注意力，常见于社交或约会场景。

definition.en: showy behavior meant to attract attention (often in dating or social situations); the act of “showing off.”
definition.zh: 为了吸引注意力（常见于社交或约会场景）而刻意炫耀、显摆的行为。

examples.en: He walked into the party peacocking in a bright jacket to get noticed.
examples.zh: 他穿着一件亮眼的夹克走进派对，刻意“孔雀开屏”想让大家注意到他。

examples.en: Some people think expensive cars are just peacocking.
examples.zh: 有些人觉得买豪车只是为了炫耀。

definition.en: (present participle) behaving in a proud, flashy way to impress others; showing off.
definition.zh: （现在分词）以骄傲、张扬的方式表现自己来给人留下深刻印象；炫耀。

examples.en: She was peacocking on social media, posting luxury photos every day.
examples.zh: 她在社交媒体上每天发奢侈生活照，有点在炫耀。

examples.en: Stop peacocking and just be yourself.
examples.zh: 别再刻意显摆了，做你自己就好。

extraExplanation: “peacocking”来自孔雀开屏：孔雀（尤其雄孔雀）会展开华丽的尾羽来吸引配偶，因此这个词常用来形容人用夸张的穿着、昂贵物品或高调举止来吸引关注。
在约会语境里，这个词有时带一点调侃或批评意味，暗示这种吸引注意的方式可能不够真诚。也可以中性使用，表示“穿得很抢眼/很出挑”。

summary.en: “Peacocks” means male peafowl (plural), famous for their colorful fan-shaped tail displays.
summary.zh: “peacocks”指“雄孔雀”（复数），以色彩斑斓、可开屏的扇形尾羽闻名。

definition.en: Plural of “peacock”: a male peafowl, known for its large, colorful tail feathers that it can spread out like a fan.
definition.zh: “peacock”的复数：雄孔雀（雄性孔雀属鸟类），以能展开华丽的大尾羽（像扇子一样）而闻名。

examples.en: The peacocks strutted across the garden, showing off their bright feathers.
examples.zh: 几只雄孔雀在花园里昂首阔步，炫耀着鲜艳的羽毛。

examples.en: Tourists stopped to photograph the peacocks when they fanned their tails.
examples.zh: 当雄孔雀开屏时，游客们停下来拍照。

examples.en: At the zoo, the peacocks sometimes wander freely near the entrance.
examples.zh: 在动物园里，雄孔雀有时会在入口附近自由走动。

extraExplanation: 英语里“peacock”常特指“雄孔雀”，而雌孔雀更常说“peahen”。更中性的总称是“peafowl”（孔雀类），复数是“peafowl/peafowls”。
“(as) proud as a peacock”（像孔雀一样骄傲）是常见表达，用来形容某人很自豪、爱炫耀。
孔雀在不同文化中常象征美丽、华贵与自尊；在一些文学作品或描述性写作里，孔雀常被用作“华丽外表/炫耀”的意象。

summary.en: Peak means the highest point or the time of greatest level; as a verb, it means to reach that highest level.
summary.zh: Peak 表示“最高点/顶峰”或“最盛时期/峰值”；作动词表示“达到顶峰”。

definition.en: the highest point of a mountain, hill, or any shape; the top
definition.zh: （山、丘或事物的）顶峰；最高点

examples.en: We finally reached the peak after a long hike.
examples.zh: 长途徒步后，我们终于到达了山顶。

examples.en: The chart shows a peak in sales during the holiday season.
examples.zh: 图表显示假期期间销量出现峰值。

definition.en: the time when something is at its highest level, best condition, or strongest point
definition.zh: （状态、水平、力量等的）巅峰期；最盛时期

examples.en: She was at the peak of her career in her thirties.
examples.zh: 她三十多岁时正处于事业巅峰。

examples.en: Traffic reaches its peak around 5 p.m.
examples.zh: 交通在下午五点左右达到高峰。

definition.en: to reach the highest point or best level; to be at your strongest or most successful
definition.zh: 达到最高点；进入最佳状态/最成功阶段

examples.en: His performance peaked in the final minutes of the game.
examples.zh: 他在比赛最后几分钟表现达到巅峰。

examples.en: The storm peaked overnight and then weakened.
examples.zh: 暴风雨在夜间达到最强，随后减弱。

definition.en: to look quickly or secretly, often from a hidden place (common in “peek”)
definition.zh: 快速/偷偷地看一眼（注意：这个含义通常写作“peek”，与“peak”常被混淆）

examples.en: I peeked through the curtain to see who was outside.
examples.zh: 我从窗帘缝里偷看外面是谁。

extraExplanation: “peak”与“peek”是英语里很常见的同音混淆：peak=顶峰/达到顶峰；peek=偷看一眼。写作时尤其要注意。
“peak”既可指具体的山峰（a snow-covered peak），也可指抽象的“峰值/高峰”（a peak in prices/traffic）。在新闻、商业和数据分析中非常常见。

summary.en: “Peaks” usually means the tops/highest points (mountain tops or figurative highs) and can also be the verb form meaning “reaches the highest level.”
summary.zh: “peaks”通常指“山峰/最高点”，也可作动词表示“达到最高水平/高峰”。

definition.en: Plural of “peak”: the pointed tops of mountains or hills; the highest points of something.
definition.zh: “peak”的复数：山峰/山顶；（事物的）最高点、顶峰。

examples.en: Snow covered the peaks in the distance.
examples.zh: 远处的山峰被白雪覆盖。

examples.en: Sales hit new peaks during the holiday season.
examples.zh: 假日季期间销量创下新高。

definition.en: Third-person singular of “peak”: reaches its highest level; becomes strongest or greatest.
definition.zh: “peak”的第三人称单数：达到最高水平；达到最强/最大。

examples.en: Traffic peaks around 8 a.m.
examples.zh: 交通在早上八点左右达到高峰。

examples.en: Her interest peaks when the story gets mysterious.
examples.zh: 当故事变得神秘时，她的兴趣达到最高。

extraExplanation: “peak(s)”既可指真实的“山峰”，也常用于比喻：如“at the peak of one’s career（事业巅峰）”“peak season（旺季）”“peak hours（高峰时段）”。在数据、流量、温度等语境里也很常见。

summary.en: Peaky means either “pointed like a peak” or (informal BrE) “looking pale and unwell.”
summary.zh: Peaky 可指“尖顶的、像山峰一样尖的”，也可（非正式英式）指“脸色差、看起来不舒服的”。

definition.en: having a pointed top; shaped like a peak.
definition.zh: 尖顶的；有山峰状尖端的。

examples.en: The roof is peaky, so snow slides off easily.
examples.zh: 这个屋顶是尖顶的，所以雪很容易滑落。

examples.en: They climbed a peaky ridge with steep sides.
examples.zh: 他们攀上了一道两侧很陡的尖峰山脊。

definition.en: (informal, especially British English) looking pale, weak, or unwell.
definition.zh: （非正式，尤指英式英语）脸色苍白、虚弱或看起来不舒服的。

examples.en: You look a bit peaky—are you getting sick?
examples.zh: 你看起来有点脸色不好——是不是要生病了？

examples.en: After the long flight, I felt peaky and tired.
examples.zh: 长途飞行后，我感觉不太舒服而且很累。

extraExplanation: “peaky”在英式口语里表示“脸色差/不舒服”很常见；美式英语里更常用“pale / sick / under the weather”。
流行文化中《Peaky Blinders》里的“Peaky”通常被理解为“戴尖帽檐（peaked cap）的人”，更多是称号/形象化用法。

summary.en: Peal means a loud ringing sound (often bells), or a sudden burst of sound like thunder or laughter; as a verb, it means to ring loudly.
summary.zh: Peal 指（常为钟声的）响亮鸣响，也可指雷声、笑声等突然的一阵声音；作动词表示“（钟等）大声鸣响”。

definition.en: a loud ringing sound, especially from bells (often a series of rings)
definition.zh: （尤指钟）响亮的钟声；一阵接连的响声

examples.en: A peal of church bells rang out across the town.
examples.zh: 一阵教堂钟声响彻全镇。

examples.en: We heard a sudden peal of thunder in the distance.
examples.zh: 我们听到远处突然传来一声响雷。

definition.en: a sudden loud sound of laughter
definition.zh: 一阵突然的大笑声

examples.en: Her joke set off a peal of laughter.
examples.zh: 她的玩笑引发了一阵大笑。

examples.en: A peal of laughter came from the next room.
examples.zh: 隔壁房间传来一阵笑声。

definition.en: to ring loudly (said of bells or similar sounds)
definition.zh: （钟等）大声鸣响；发出洪亮的声音

examples.en: The bells pealed to celebrate the wedding.
examples.zh: 钟声大作，庆祝婚礼。

examples.en: At noon, the clock tower pealed over the square.
examples.zh: 中午时分，钟楼的钟声在广场上空回荡。

extraExplanation: “peal”常和bells（钟）、thunder（雷）、laughter（笑声）搭配，强调“洪亮、清脆、成串/一阵”的声音效果。文学描写里常用来营造节庆、庄严或戏剧性的氛围。

summary.en: A peanut is an edible seed often eaten as a snack or made into peanut butter; informally, “peanuts” can mean a very small amount of money.
summary.zh: peanut 指可食用的花生（常作零食或花生酱）；口语中 peanuts 也可指“很少的钱/微不足道的报酬”。

definition.en: A small, oval, light-brown nut-like seed that grows underground and is eaten as food (often roasted, salted, or made into peanut butter).
definition.zh: 花生；落花生（长在地下的种子，常被烤、加盐食用或做成花生酱）

examples.en: I packed a peanut butter sandwich for lunch.
examples.zh: 我午餐带了一个花生酱三明治。

examples.en: Some snacks may contain peanuts, so check the label.
examples.zh: 有些零食可能含花生，所以要看清标签。

examples.en: Peanuts are often served at baseball games in the U.S.
examples.zh: 在美国的棒球比赛上，经常会卖花生来吃。

definition.en: (Informal) Something very small in size or value; a tiny amount of money.
definition.zh: （非正式）很少的钱；微不足道的东西

examples.en: They offered him peanuts for such a difficult job.
examples.zh: 这么难的工作，他们给的报酬少得可怜。

examples.en: I can’t fix my car for peanuts—it costs real money.
examples.zh: 修车不可能只花一点点钱——得花真金白银。

synonyms: peanuts (informal: a tiny amount of money)
extraExplanation: “peanut”虽然字面像“豆（pea）+坚果（nut）”，但花生在植物学上属于豆科（legume），和豌豆、豆子更接近；因为外形和吃法像坚果，所以英语里叫“peanut”。
美国文化里花生很常见：除了零食和花生酱，也常出现在“peanuts（很少的钱）”这类口语表达中，用来强调报酬或数量非常少。
食物语境中要注意过敏：英语里常见提示如“contains peanuts / may contain traces of peanuts（可能含有微量花生）”。

summary.en: A pear is a sweet fruit (or the tree that grows it), shaped wider at the bottom and narrower at the top.
summary.zh: pear 指“梨”（或“梨树”），常见特征是下宽上窄、味道香甜多汁。

definition.en: a sweet, juicy fruit with a round bottom and a narrower top, usually eaten fresh or cooked
definition.zh: 梨；一种甜、多汁的水果，底部圆、顶部较窄，通常生吃或烹饪后食用

examples.en: I ate a pear after lunch.
examples.zh: 午饭后我吃了一个梨。

examples.en: This salad tastes great with pear slices and walnuts.
examples.zh: 这道沙拉配梨片和核桃很好吃。

examples.en: She baked pears with honey and cinnamon.
examples.zh: 她用蜂蜜和肉桂烤梨。

definition.en: the tree that produces pears
definition.zh: 梨树；结梨的树

examples.en: A pear tree grows in our backyard.
examples.zh: 我们后院长着一棵梨树。

extraExplanation: “Pear”在英语文学与诗歌里常用来营造“丰收、温柔、秋天”的意象。比如常见的搭配有“ripe pears（成熟的梨）”“orchard pears（果园里的梨）”。
常见搭配：pear juice（梨汁）、pear jam（梨酱）、pear orchard（梨园）、a pear-shaped figure（梨形身材；也可指“梨形”的物体外形）。

summary.en: Pearce is a surname (and sometimes a given name) pronounced like “pierce.”
summary.zh: Pearce 是一个姓氏（有时也作名字），读音与“pierce”相同。

definition.en: a family name (surname), sometimes used as a given name; pronounced the same as “pierce.”
definition.zh: 姓氏（有时也作名字使用）；读音与“pierce”相同。

examples.en: Ms. Pearce will lead the meeting today.
examples.zh: Pearce 女士今天将主持会议。

examples.en: My English teacher’s last name is Pearce.
examples.zh: 我的英语老师姓 Pearce。

extraExplanation: “Pearce”主要是英语世界的姓氏，常被认为是名字 Piers 的变体，而 Piers 又与 Peter（彼得）有关。
学习中常见混淆：Pearce（人名/姓氏）与 pierce（动词“刺穿、穿透”）同音但不同义，写作时要特别注意拼写与大小写（Pearce 需大写）。

summary.en: A pearl is a gem made inside a mollusk, and it can also mean something (or someone) very valuable or a “pearl of wisdom.”
summary.zh: Pearl 指“珍珠”，也可引申为“珍贵的人或物”，常见搭配有“pearl of wisdom（至理名言）”。

definition.en: a small, round, usually white gem formed inside an oyster or other mollusk, often used in jewelry
definition.zh: 珍珠；由牡蛎等软体动物体内形成的圆润宝石，常用于首饰

examples.en: She wore a necklace of pearls to the wedding.
examples.zh: 她在婚礼上戴了一串珍珠项链。

examples.en: This ring has a single pearl in the center.
examples.zh: 这枚戒指中央镶着一颗珍珠。

definition.en: a person or thing that is very valuable, rare, or excellent (often used as a compliment)
definition.zh: 珍贵的人或物；难得的优秀之物（常用作称赞）

examples.en: Our new teacher is a real pearl—patient and kind.
examples.zh: 我们的新老师真是个宝——有耐心又善良。

examples.en: That advice was a pearl of wisdom.
examples.zh: 那条建议是一句至理名言。

definition.en: to make or decorate with pearls; to form into small pearl-like drops (less common)
definition.zh: 用珍珠装饰；形成如珍珠般的小滴（较少见）

examples.en: Dew pearled on the grass in the early morning.
examples.zh: 清晨露珠像珍珠一样在草地上闪闪发亮。

extraExplanation: “Pearl of wisdom（至理名言）”是很常见的固定搭配，表示“简短但非常有价值的建议/观点”。
文化提示：在西方文化里，珍珠常与“纯洁、优雅”联系在一起，所以常用于婚礼首饰；同时也常出现在文学中用来象征珍贵之物。

summary.en: A pearl is a gemstone from a mollusk, and it can also mean a valuable piece of wisdom or something precious.
summary.zh: pearl 指“珍珠”，也可引申为“珍贵之物/精华”，如“箴言”。

definition.en: A small, smooth, round gemstone formed inside an oyster or other mollusk, often used in jewelry.
definition.zh: 珍珠（在牡蛎等软体动物体内形成的圆润宝石，常用于首饰）

examples.en: She wore a necklace of pearls to the wedding.
examples.zh: 她在婚礼上戴了一串珍珠项链。

examples.en: Natural pearls are rarer than cultured pearls.
examples.zh: 天然珍珠比养殖珍珠更稀有。

definition.en: Something very valuable, wise, or beautiful—especially a brief piece of advice or insight.
definition.zh: 珍贵之物；精华；箴言（尤指简短而有价值的建议或见解）

examples.en: My grandmother shared a pearl of wisdom: “Save a little every month.”
examples.zh: 我奶奶分享了一条人生箴言：“每个月都要存一点钱。”

examples.en: There are pearls of truth in his speech.
examples.zh: 他的演讲里有一些真知灼见。

extraExplanation: “Pearl of wisdom（箴言/至理名言）”很常见，表示一句简短却很受用的建议。
在英语文学与文化里，pearls 常象征“纯洁、珍贵、泪水”。比如“pearls of tears”可形容泪珠像珍珠一样。
相关常见表达：cast pearls before swine（把珍珠丢在猪前：把好东西给不懂珍惜的人，出自《圣经》）。

summary.en: “Pearls” usually means the gemstones used in jewelry, and it can also mean valuable pieces of advice (“pearls of wisdom”).
summary.zh: “Pearls”通常指用于首饰的“珍珠”，也可比喻“宝贵的忠告/名言”（如 pearls of wisdom）。

definition.en: A small, smooth, round gemstone formed inside some oysters and other shellfish, often used in jewelry.
definition.zh: 珍珠；由某些牡蛎等贝类体内形成的圆润宝石，常用于首饰。

examples.en: She wore a necklace of pearls at the wedding.
examples.zh: 她在婚礼上戴了一条珍珠项链。

examples.en: Natural pearls are rare and expensive.
examples.zh: 天然珍珠稀有而昂贵。

definition.en: A set or group of pearls, especially as jewelry (often used as a plural noun).
definition.zh: （尤指作为首饰的）一串/一套珍珠（常用复数形式）。

examples.en: He gave her pearls for their anniversary.
examples.zh: 他在结婚纪念日送她珍珠。

examples.en: The old pearls were kept in a velvet box.
examples.zh: 那串老珍珠放在一个天鹅绒盒子里。

definition.en: A very valuable or wise idea, piece of advice, or memorable saying (often used as “pearls of wisdom,” sometimes ironically).
definition.zh: 珍贵/睿智的想法或忠告；名言（常见搭配“pearls of wisdom”，有时带讽刺意味）。

examples.en: My grandfather shared a few pearls of wisdom about work and life.
examples.zh: 爷爷分享了几条关于工作和生活的“金玉良言”。

examples.en: He offered his “pearls of wisdom,” but nobody asked for advice.
examples.zh: 他又抛出他的“高见”，但其实没人请他出主意。（略带讽刺）

extraExplanation: “Pearl(s)”常与品质、纯净和经典优雅联系在一起，因此在英语文化里也常被用来比喻“珍贵的东西/宝贵的话”。
常见固定搭配：pearl necklace（珍珠项链），string of pearls（一串珍珠），pearl earrings（珍珠耳环），pearls of wisdom（金玉良言/高见）。
拼写提示：单数 pearl；复数 pearls。发音中 /pɝːlz/ 末尾的 /lz/ 连读会让结尾听起来更“紧”。

summary.en: “Pearly” means pearl-like (soft white and shiny) or made/decorated with pearls.
summary.zh: “pearly”表示“像珍珠一样（柔白且有光泽）”，也可指“由珍珠制成或装饰有珍珠”。

definition.en: Like a pearl in appearance (especially a soft white color or a gentle, shiny luster).
definition.zh: 像珍珠的；带珍珠光泽的（尤指柔和的白色或温润的光泽）。

examples.en: She wore a pearly white dress.
examples.zh: 她穿了一件珍珠白的连衣裙。

examples.en: The morning light made the sea look pearly.
examples.zh: 清晨的光让大海看起来泛着珍珠般的光泽。

definition.en: Made of pearls or decorated with pearls.
definition.zh: 由珍珠制成的；镶有/装饰有珍珠的。

examples.en: He gave her a pearly necklace for her birthday.
examples.zh: 他生日时送给她一条珍珠项链。

examples.en: The crown had a pearly border.
examples.zh: 王冠的边缘镶着珍珠。

extraExplanation: “pearly”常用来形容颜色与光泽（pearly white）而不一定真的有珍珠。它比“white”更有画面感，带一点柔和、发亮、略带奶白的感觉。
搭配很常见：pearly teeth（洁白的牙齿，偏文学/广告用语）、pearly sheen/glow（珍珠般的光泽/微光）。注意不要和“pearlly”拼错，标准拼法是“pearly”。

summary.en: Pears are sweet, juicy fruits; the word can also mean the pear tree. “Pears” is the plural of “pear.”
summary.zh: pears 是 pear（梨）的复数，指甜而多汁的梨，也可指梨树。

definition.en: A sweet, juicy fruit with a rounded bottom and a narrower top, usually with thin green, yellow, or brown skin.
definition.zh: 梨；一种甜而多汁的水果，通常下圆上窄，外皮多为绿色、黄色或褐色。

examples.en: I bought some pears at the market for a fruit salad.
examples.zh: 我在市场买了一些梨，用来做水果沙拉。

examples.en: This pear is ripe and very juicy.
examples.zh: 这颗梨熟了，非常多汁。

definition.en: The pear tree, the tree that grows pears.
definition.zh: 梨树；结梨的树。

examples.en: A pear tree grows in their backyard.
examples.zh: 他们后院里长着一棵梨树。

extraExplanation: “pears”是“pear”的复数形式；在点餐或购物时常用复数：two pears / a bag of pears。
在英式与美式英语中，“pear”发音基本一致；常见搭配有：pear juice（梨汁）、pear jam（梨酱）、pear crumble（梨酥烤甜点）。
文化小提示：在中文语境里“梨”和“离”同音，所以有些场合会避免“分梨”（听起来像“分离”）。英语里没有这种谐音联想。

summary.en: Peas are small round seeds eaten as a vegetable, usually cooked or added to dishes.
summary.zh: peas 指常见的豌豆（豌豆粒），通常作为蔬菜食用，可煮熟或加入菜肴中。

definition.en: a small, round green seed eaten as a vegetable, usually from a pod (often used as a plural food word: “peas”)
definition.zh: 豌豆；（通常用复数作食物名）豌豆粒

examples.en: I like peas with rice.
examples.zh: 我喜欢把豌豆配米饭吃。

examples.en: She bought frozen peas for dinner.
examples.zh: 她买了冷冻豌豆做晚饭。

examples.en: We grew peas in the garden last spring.
examples.zh: 去年春天我们在花园里种了豌豆。

definition.en: (singular) one single seed of a pea plant
definition.zh: （单数）一粒豌豆

examples.en: There was only one pea left on the plate.
examples.zh: 盘子里只剩下一粒豌豆。

examples.en: The baby picked up a pea with his fingers.
examples.zh: 宝宝用手指捏起了一粒豌豆。

extraExplanation: “Peas”在英语里常作为不可数的“食物概念”来用（虽然形式是复数），比如：I had peas for lunch. 但如果强调数量，会用可数表达：three peas / a few peas。
常见搭配：green peas（青豌豆）、peas and carrots（豌豆胡萝卜丁）、split peas（干豌豆瓣，用来煮汤，如 split pea soup）。

summary.en: “Peasant” most commonly means a poor farmer in historical contexts; it can also be an insulting word for someone seen as low-class.
summary.zh: “peasant”最常指历史语境中的贫穷农民；也可作贬义词，指被认为“低等/没教养”的人（不礼貌）。

definition.en: a poor farmer or farm worker, especially in the past, who worked on a small piece of land or for a landlord
definition.zh: （尤指过去的）农民、佃农；贫穷的乡村劳作者（常在小块土地上耕作或为地主劳动）

examples.en: In the Middle Ages, many peasants worked the lord’s land and paid rent in crops.
examples.zh: 在中世纪，许多农民耕作领主的土地，并用粮食来交租。

examples.en: The novel follows a peasant family struggling through a harsh winter.
examples.zh: 这部小说描写一个农民家庭在严冬中艰难度日。

definition.en: a person seen as uneducated or having low social status (often insulting or old-fashioned)
definition.zh: （常带侮辱或陈旧色彩）被认为没教养或社会地位低的人

examples.en: Calling someone a “peasant” is rude and can sound classist.
examples.zh: 叫别人“peasant（乡巴佬/贱民）”很粗鲁，也可能带有阶级歧视。

examples.en: He used the word “peasant” to look down on others, which offended people.
examples.zh: 他用“peasant”来贬低他人，让人感到被冒犯。

extraExplanation: “peasant”在历史与文学语境中常用于描述欧洲（如中世纪、近代早期）乡村劳动者阶层，强调与地主、贵族相对的社会地位。
现代日常英语里，如果想表达“农村/朴素/不时髦”，更中性的说法通常是 “rural person”, “villager”（在特定国家语境下）或直接描述行为与背景；把“peasant”用来骂人容易显得刻薄或带阶级偏见。
常见搭配：peasant farmer（自耕/小农）、peasant revolt（农民起义）、the peasantry（农民阶层，集合名词）。

summary.en: “Peasants” is the plural of “peasant”: historically, poor rural farmers; in modern speech, it can be an offensive insult meaning a “low-class” person.
summary.zh: “peasants”是“peasant”的复数：历史上指贫穷的农村农民；现代口语中也可能作为带侮辱性的词，贬低别人“低等/下等”。

definition.en: A person of a low social rank, especially a poor farmer living in the countryside (common in pre-industrial Europe and similar societies).
definition.zh: （尤指旧时欧洲等社会的）农民；乡下的贫穷农户；（传统社会中）社会地位较低的人。

examples.en: In the Middle Ages, many peasants worked on a lord’s land in exchange for protection.
examples.zh: 在中世纪，许多农民在领主的土地上劳动，以换取保护。

examples.en: The novel describes how peasants struggled through hard winters and heavy taxes.
examples.zh: 这部小说描写了农民如何在严冬和沉重税赋下艰难生存。

definition.en: (Often offensive) A rude or uneducated person; a term used to insult someone as “lower-class.”
definition.zh: （常带侮辱性）粗鲁或没教养的人；用来贬低别人“低等/下等”的说法。

examples.en: He called the waiter a “peasant,” which was disrespectful and classist.
examples.zh: 他叫服务员“peasant”，既不尊重人，也带有阶级歧视。

examples.en: Try not to use “peasant” as an insult—it can be hurtful.
examples.zh: 尽量别把“peasant”当侮辱词用——这可能会伤人。

extraExplanation: “peasant”这个词在历史语境里多指以农业为生的基层民众（常见于欧洲封建时期）。但在现代日常英语里，把别人称作“a peasant”很容易显得傲慢、带阶级偏见，通常不建议使用。
更中性/现代的表达可用：“farmer”（农民/农场主）、“rural worker”（农村劳动者）、“agricultural worker”（农业工人）。
文学中常用“peasants”来描写社会结构与阶级矛盾，例如讨论革命、饥荒、赋税、土地制度等主题。

summary.en: “Pease” is an old-fashioned word meaning “peas,” now mainly seen in the phrase “pease porridge.”
summary.zh: “Pease”是“peas（豌豆）”的旧式说法，如今多见于短语“pease porridge”。

definition.en: (Archaic) peas; the plural form once commonly used for “pea.”
definition.zh: （古语）豌豆；曾经常用的“pea（豌豆）”的复数形式。

examples.en: In older English, “pease” was used where we now say “peas.”
examples.zh: 在较早期的英语里，人们会用“pease”，而现在我们说“peas”。

examples.en: The rhyme mentions “pease porridge,” meaning a porridge or stew made with peas.
examples.zh: 童谣里提到“pease porridge”，指用豌豆做的粥或炖食。

extraExplanation: “Pease”在现代英语里几乎不单独使用，主要出现在传统表达或旧文学中。英语里“pea”的单数形式是后来从“pease”（被当作不可数/集合名词）“误切分”出来的：人们把结尾的 -s 误以为复数词尾，于是创造了单数“pea”，再形成现代复数“peas”。
常见文化出现：童谣《Pease Porridge Hot》（“Pease porridge hot, pease porridge cold…”），这里的“pease porridge”大致相当于“pea porridge/pea soup”。

summary.en: Peat is partly decayed plant material from bogs, used as fuel or in gardening; less commonly, it can be a verb meaning to cover with or dig peat.
summary.zh: peat 指沼泽中形成的半腐烂植物物质“泥炭”，可作燃料或园艺材料；较少见时也可作动词，表示用泥炭覆盖或挖掘泥炭。

definition.en: Dark, partly decayed plant material that forms in wet, acidic places (like bogs). It can be cut and dried for fuel, or used in gardening to improve soil.
definition.zh: 泥炭：在潮湿、酸性的环境（如沼泽）中形成的深色、半腐烂植物物质。可切割晾干作燃料，也常用于园艺改良土壤。

examples.en: Peat forms slowly in cold, wet bogs over thousands of years.
examples.zh: 泥炭在寒冷潮湿的泥炭沼泽中，经过数千年缓慢形成。

examples.en: The garden center sells bags of peat for potting mixes.
examples.zh: 园艺店出售用于配土的袋装泥炭。

examples.en: Some homes once burned dried peat to heat rooms.
examples.zh: 过去有些家庭会燃烧晾干的泥炭来取暖。

definition.en: To cover something with peat, or to dig out peat from the ground (less common).
definition.zh: （较少用）用泥炭覆盖；或从地里挖掘泥炭。

examples.en: In the past, people peated the fire to keep it burning longer.
examples.zh: 过去人们会往火里加泥炭，让火烧得更久。

examples.en: They peated the soil around the plants to keep moisture in.
examples.zh: 他们用泥炭覆盖植物周围的土壤以保持湿度。

extraExplanation: “peat”在苏格兰、爱尔兰等地的文化里很常见：传统上会切割泥炭（cut peat）晾干当燃料。现代环保讨论中，泥炭地是重要“碳汇”，开采泥炭会释放大量二氧化碳，因此园艺领域也常提倡减少使用泥炭，改用椰糠（coco coir）等替代品。
你可能在威士忌描述里见到“peaty”：指带有“烟熏、泥炭味”的风味，尤其常见于苏格兰艾雷岛（Islay）威士忌。

summary.en: Peat is partly decayed plant material from bogs, used for fuel or gardening; it can also be a verb meaning to dig peat.
summary.zh: Peat 指沼泽里形成的泥炭，可用作燃料或园艺改良土壤；也可作动词表示“挖泥炭”。

definition.en: Partly decayed plant material that forms in wet, boggy areas; it can be dried and used as fuel or to improve soil.
definition.zh: 泥炭：在潮湿沼泽环境中由部分腐烂的植物堆积形成的物质；可干燥后用作燃料，也可用于改良土壤。

examples.en: The gardeners added peat to help the soil hold moisture.
examples.zh: 园丁加入泥炭，帮助土壤保持水分。

examples.en: Some homes in Ireland still burn peat as a traditional fuel.
examples.zh: 在爱尔兰，一些家庭仍会燃烧泥炭作为传统燃料。

examples.en: Peat bogs store a lot of carbon and are important for the climate.
examples.zh: 泥炭沼泽储存大量碳，对气候很重要。

definition.en: To cut or dig peat from the ground, especially for use as fuel.
definition.zh: 挖（或切）泥炭（尤指作为燃料使用）。

examples.en: In the past, families would peat in summer and dry the blocks for winter.
examples.zh: 过去，人们会在夏天挖泥炭，把泥炭块晾干留到冬天用。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“peata”在英语里不常见，可能是想查“peat”（泥炭）。如果你指的是缩写“PETA”（善待动物组织 People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals），告诉我我也可以给你那一条词条。

summary.en: A pebble is a small smooth stone; it can also mean to cover a surface with small stones.
summary.zh: pebble 指小而光滑的卵石；也可作动词，表示用卵石铺或装饰表面。

definition.en: a small, smooth stone, often found on a beach or in a river
definition.zh: 卵石；小圆石（常见于海滩或河边）

examples.en: The beach was covered with colorful pebbles.
examples.zh: 海滩上满是彩色的卵石。

examples.en: He skipped a pebble across the water.
examples.zh: 他把一颗小石子在水面上打水漂。

definition.en: to cover, decorate, or pave a surface with small stones
definition.zh: 用卵石铺（路面）；用小石子装饰（表面）

examples.en: They pebbled the garden path to stop it from getting muddy.
examples.zh: 他们用卵石铺了花园小路，防止变得泥泞。

examples.en: The courtyard was pebbled for a natural look.
examples.zh: 庭院用卵石铺装，呈现自然的风格。

extraExplanation: “Pebble”通常指较小、被水流或海浪磨圆的石头；比“stone”更强调“小、圆润、光滑”。
常见搭配：pebble beach（卵石海滩），pebble stone（卵石/鹅卵石），pebble path（卵石小径），pebble-dashed（外墙用小石子抹面的一种做法，英式用法较多）。

summary.en: “Pebbles” means small, smooth stones; it can also be a verb meaning to cover a surface with small stones.
summary.zh: “pebbles”指小而圆润的卵石；也可作动词，表示用小卵石铺地面等。

definition.en: Small, smooth stones, often found on beaches or in riverbeds.
definition.zh: 小卵石；（常指海滩或河床上的）圆润小石子。

examples.en: The beach was covered with white pebbles.
examples.zh: 海滩上铺满了白色的卵石。

examples.en: She skipped a pebble across the lake.
examples.zh: 她把一颗小石子打水漂，掠过湖面。

examples.en: I can hear pebbles crunching under my shoes.
examples.zh: 我能听见脚下卵石被踩得咯吱作响。

definition.en: To cover a surface with small stones (often for paths or gardens).
definition.zh: 用小卵石铺（路面、花园小径等）。

examples.en: They pebbled the walkway to keep it from getting muddy.
examples.zh: 他们用卵石铺了人行道，防止变得泥泞。

examples.en: The courtyard was pebbled in a simple black-and-white pattern.
examples.zh: 庭院用黑白卵石铺成了简单的图案。

extraExplanation: “Pebble”通常指比“stone”更小、且更圆滑的石头；和“gravel（碎石）”相比，pebbles一般更大、更圆，常用于园艺装饰或海滩地貌描写。
文学与意象里，pebbles常被用来表现“细小却真实的事物”、时间的磨圆、或旅途中脚下的触感。常见搭配有：pebble beach（卵石滩）、pebble-strewn（布满卵石的）。

summary.en: A pecan is a North American nut often used in cooking (especially desserts like pecan pie); it can also describe foods made with that nut.
summary.zh: pecan 指北美常见的山核桃坚果，常用于烹饪（尤其甜点如山核桃派）；也可作形容词表示“山核桃的/山核桃味的”。

definition.en: A type of sweet, buttery-tasting nut from a tree native to North America, often used in desserts and cooking.
definition.zh: 一种原产于北美的坚果，味道香甜带奶油感，常用于甜点和烹饪。

examples.en: She added chopped pecans to the salad for extra crunch.
examples.zh: 她在沙拉里加了切碎的山核桃，让口感更脆。

examples.en: Pecan pie is a classic dessert in the southern United States.
examples.zh: 山核桃派是美国南部非常经典的甜点。

examples.en: This ice cream has pecans and caramel swirls.
examples.zh: 这款冰淇淋里有山核桃和焦糖纹路。

definition.en: Relating to or flavored with pecans.
definition.zh: 与山核桃有关的；山核桃味的。

examples.en: I ordered a pecan muffin and a coffee.
examples.zh: 我点了一个山核桃松饼和一杯咖啡。

examples.en: They sell pecan cookies during the holidays.
examples.zh: 他们在节日期间卖山核桃饼干。

extraExplanation: “pecan”常读作两种常见重音：PEE-kan 或 puh-KAHN；不同地区（尤其美国南部与其他地区）偏好不同，但都很常见、都算自然。
山核桃在美国饮食文化中很常见，特别是在南方料理与节庆甜点里（如 pecan pie）。另外它和 walnut（核桃）外形相似，但风味通常更甜、更奶香。

summary.en: A peccadillo is a minor mistake or small wrongdoing that isn’t very serious.
summary.zh: peccadillo 指不太严重的小过失、小错。

definition.en: a small, minor mistake or offense; a trivial wrongdoing
definition.zh: 小过失；小罪过；无伤大雅的错误/冒犯

examples.en: Being a few minutes late is a peccadillo, not a serious problem.
examples.zh: 迟到几分钟只是小过失，并不是严重问题。

examples.en: He admitted his peccadillo of checking his phone during meetings.
examples.zh: 他承认自己在会议中看手机这个小毛病。

examples.en: The tabloids love to report celebrities’ peccadilloes.
examples.zh: 小报很爱报道名人的小过失/小丑闻。

extraExplanation: 词源：来自西班牙语 peccadillo（“小罪过”），其根源与拉丁语 peccare（“犯罪；犯错”）有关。语气通常比 “crime/sin” 轻很多，强调“无伤大雅、可被原谅的小错”。
使用提示：peccadillo 常用于较正式或文学化的语境，带一点“轻描淡写”的意味；如果要更口语，可以用 minor mistake / small fault / little slip。
文学/文化用法：在小说、随笔、评论中常用来对比更严重的道德或法律问题，例如 “a peccadillo compared with …（与……相比只是小事）”。

summary.en: Peccant means “sinful” or “guilty of wrongdoing,” used in formal or literary contexts.
summary.zh: peccant 意为“有罪的、罪恶的”，多用于正式、文学或宗教语境。

definition.en: sinful; morally wrong; doing something that is considered a sin or serious wrongdoing.
definition.zh: 有罪的；犯（道德或宗教意义上的）过错的；罪恶的。

examples.en: In the novel, the hero tries to escape his peccant past and begin again.
examples.zh: 在小说里，主人公试图摆脱他有罪的过去，重新开始。

examples.en: The preacher warned the community against peccant behavior.
examples.zh: 牧师告诫社区要远离罪恶的行为。

extraExplanation: “peccant”较为正式、偏文学或宗教语境，日常口语里更常用 sinful, wrong, immoral。
词源来自拉丁语 peccare（“犯错、犯罪、犯过”）。在文学中常用于描写人物的“有罪/堕落”状态，带有道德评判色彩。
搭配提示：peccant + past/ways/behavior/soul（有罪的过去/行径/行为/灵魂）。近义词：sinful, immoral, wicked（语气更强）。反义词：innocent, virtuous。

summary.en: Peche is usually the French word pêche (“peach”), seen in English mainly in culinary contexts; much more rarely it can reflect French péché (“sin”).
summary.zh: peche 通常对应法语 pêche（“桃子”），在英语里多见于美食语境；更少见的情况下也可能对应法语 péché（“罪”）。

definition.en: (French loanword, used in English mainly in food/wine writing) a peach; peach-flavored or peach-related.
definition.zh: （法语外来词，英语中多见于美食/葡萄酒语境）桃子；桃子味的；与桃子有关的。

examples.en: The menu listed a tart topped with fresh pêche and cream.
examples.zh: 菜单上写着一款上面铺着新鲜桃子和奶油的挞。

examples.en: This cocktail has notes of pêche and citrus.
examples.zh: 这款鸡尾酒带有桃子和柑橘的风味。

examples.en: Pêche Melba is a classic dessert made with peaches, ice cream, and raspberry sauce.
examples.zh: “蜜桃梅尔巴”是一道经典甜点，用桃子、冰淇淋和覆盆子酱制作。

definition.en: (Rare in English; from French péché) “sin,” especially when a French title/phrase is kept in French.
definition.zh: （英语中较少见；源自法语 péché）“罪；罪过”，常见于保留法语的书名/短语中。

examples.en: The film title includes the word péché (“sin”) to keep the French tone.
examples.zh: 这部电影片名里用了 péché（“罪”）来保留法语风格。

extraExplanation: 在法语里，“pêche”（桃子）和“péché”（罪）写法不同：一个是“ê”，一个是“é”。英语里有时会把重音符号省略写成 peche，容易混淆。
如果你本来想查的是英语单词“peach”（桃子），拼写是 peach，发音也不同。你可以告诉我你想要哪一个，我可以给你更贴近的词条与用法。

summary.en: A pecan is a sweet nut (or the tree that produces it), common in American cooking—especially in pecan pie.
summary.zh: Pecan 指山核桃坚果（也可指山核桃树），在美式料理中很常见，尤其是山核桃派。

definition.en: a sweet, buttery nut with a hard shell, often eaten roasted or used in desserts
definition.zh: 山核桃（美洲胡桃）坚果；味道香甜、油润，常烤着吃或用于甜点

examples.en: I bought a bag of roasted pecans.
examples.zh: 我买了一袋烤山核桃仁。

examples.en: Pecan pie is a popular dessert in the southern United States.
examples.zh: 山核桃派是美国南部很受欢迎的甜点。

definition.en: the North American tree that produces pecans
definition.zh: 山核桃树（产山核桃坚果的北美树种）

examples.en: There’s a pecan tree in their backyard.
examples.zh: 他们后院里有一棵山核桃树。

extraExplanation: “pecian”不是常见的英文拼写；你很可能想查的是 **pecan**（山核桃）。
**pecan** 这个词来自北美原住民语言（阿尔冈昆语系），大意与“需要用石头敲碎的坚果”有关。
美式英语里它的读音有地区差异：有人读得更像 /pɪˈkɑn/（常见于美国南部），也有人读得更像 /ˈpiːkæn/。两种都能被理解。

summary.en: “Peck” most commonly means to make quick, light strikes (like a bird’s beak) or to give a quick, light kiss; it can also mean a dry-measure unit called a peck.
summary.zh: “peck”最常指（像鸟喙一样）快速轻啄/轻点，或“轻轻一吻”；也可指干量单位“配克”。

definition.en: to strike or bite quickly with a beak (or like a beak); to make small, sharp touches
definition.zh: （鸟）用喙快速啄；（像鸟啄一样）轻轻而快速地点/戳

examples.en: The bird pecked at the seeds on the ground.
examples.zh: 那只鸟在地上啄食种子。

examples.en: She pecked me on the cheek before leaving.
examples.zh: 她离开前轻轻亲了我一下脸颊。

examples.en: He pecked at the keyboard with one finger.
examples.zh: 他用一根手指在键盘上笨拙地敲着。

definition.en: a quick, light kiss; a small bite or strike (especially by a bird)
definition.zh: 轻轻一吻；（尤指鸟的）轻啄/小咬/轻击

examples.en: He gave his daughter a peck on the forehead.
examples.zh: 他在女儿额头上轻轻亲了一下。

examples.en: The chicken gave my shoe a peck.
examples.zh: 那只鸡轻啄了我的鞋子一下。

definition.en: a unit of dry volume (U.S. and U.K.), used for foods like apples or potatoes
definition.zh: 配克（干量单位，用于苹果、土豆等；美制/英制均有，但容量略有差别）

examples.en: We bought a peck of apples at the farm stand.
examples.zh: 我们在农场摊位买了一配克苹果。

extraExplanation: “peck”作动词时常带有“反复、小幅度、轻而快”的感觉：peck at + 名词 很常见，表示“啄/一点点地吃/不停地轻敲”。
表示“轻吻”时更口语、亲昵，但通常比“kiss”更轻、更快：a peck on the cheek/forehead。
“a peck of apples”属于较传统的度量说法，如今在日常生活中不如“pound(s)”常见，但在农场市集、乡村语境或童谣/谚语里仍会出现（如：a peck of pickled peppers）。

summary.en: “Pecked” means “struck/picked at quickly,” often with a beak; it can also mean “ate in small bites” or “gave a quick kiss.”
summary.zh: “pecked”是“peck”的过去式/过去分词：常指（用鸟喙）快速啄/啄击；也可指小口吃，或（非正式）快速轻吻。

definition.en: Past tense and past participle of “peck”: to strike or pick at something quickly with a beak (or with short, sharp movements).
definition.zh: “peck”的过去式和过去分词：用鸟喙快速啄、啄击；也可指用短促、尖锐的动作戳/点。

examples.en: The chicken pecked the ground looking for seeds.
examples.zh: 小鸡啄着地面找种子。

examples.en: A woodpecker pecked holes in the tree.
examples.zh: 啄木鸟在树上啄出洞来。

definition.en: To eat something in small bites; to nibble.
definition.zh: 小口小口地吃；一点点地啃/啄食。

examples.en: She pecked at her salad because she wasn’t very hungry.
examples.zh: 她不太饿，只是小口小口地吃沙拉。

examples.en: He barely pecked at his dinner during the meeting.
examples.zh: 开会时他几乎没怎么吃晚饭。

definition.en: (Informal) To give a quick, light kiss.
definition.zh: （非正式）轻轻、快速地亲一下。

examples.en: He pecked her on the cheek before leaving.
examples.zh: 他出门前在她脸颊上轻轻亲了一下。

examples.en: She pecked him goodbye at the door.
examples.zh: 她在门口轻轻亲了他一下道别。

extraExplanation: “peck”常和介词at连用：peck at 除了“啄/小口吃”，还可以表示“挑剔、唠叨式地批评”（多指反复、小幅度地惹人烦）。例如：He felt pecked at by his boss.（他觉得老板老是挑他毛病。）
“peck”还有名词用法（a peck），指“一啄/一下”，也可指一种英美旧制干量单位（约等于8夸脱），但日常口语里相对少见。

summary.en: “Pecker” usually means a bird’s beak, but it can also be a vulgar slang word for a penis—use with caution.
summary.zh: “pecker”通常指鸟的喙，但也可作粗俗俚语指阴茎——使用需谨慎。

definition.en: A bird’s beak; also used for a bird that pecks (especially in names like “woodpecker”).
definition.zh: 鸟的喙；也可指会啄食的鸟（尤其出现在“woodpecker 啄木鸟”等词里）。

examples.en: The bird used its pecker to crack the seed.
examples.zh: 那只鸟用喙啄开了种子。

examples.en: A woodpecker’s pecker is strong enough to tap into tree bark.
examples.zh: 啄木鸟的喙很结实，能敲进树皮。

definition.en: (Informal, vulgar slang) A penis.
definition.zh: （非正式、粗俗俚语）阴茎。

examples.en: That word is vulgar—avoid using it in polite conversation.
examples.zh: 那个词很粗俗——在正式或礼貌的场合要避免使用。

examples.en: In many workplaces, using slang like that can be considered harassment.
examples.zh: 在许多工作场所，使用那种俚语可能会被视为骚扰。

extraExplanation: “pecker”这个词在日常英语里有两个落差很大的意思：一个是中性（鸟喙/与啄木鸟相关），另一个是粗俗俚语（指男性生殖器）。因为后者很容易让人尴尬或被认为不礼貌，学习者在不确定语境时最好避免使用，改用更中性的表达（如 beak，或直接说 woodpecker）。

summary.en: “Pecking” usually means making quick small strikes/bites (like a bird), and it also appears in “pecking order” meaning a social ranking.
summary.zh: “Pecking”常指像鸟一样快速小幅度地啄/戳；也常见于“pecking order”，表示群体中的等级/排位。

definition.en: the -ing form of “peck”: to strike or pick at something quickly with the beak (or in a similar small, quick way).
definition.zh: “peck”的现在分词形式：用喙快速啄/啄击；也可指用类似方式轻快地戳、点。

examples.en: The bird was pecking at the seeds on the ground.
examples.zh: 那只鸟在地上啄食种子。

examples.en: He kept pecking at his keyboard with two fingers.
examples.zh: 他一直用两根手指在键盘上“点点戳戳”地打字。

definition.en: a series of small, quick bites or taps (often used with “at”).
definition.zh: （常与 at 连用）一连串小而快的啄、咬、轻点。

examples.en: She took a few pecking bites of her sandwich and went back to work.
examples.zh: 她匆匆小口咬了几下三明治，就又去工作了。

definition.en: used in the phrase “pecking order”: a social ranking that shows who has more power or priority.
definition.zh: 用于短语 “pecking order”：等级/排位（表示谁更有权力或更优先）。

examples.en: In the office pecking order, interns usually have the least influence.
examples.zh: 在办公室的等级序列里，实习生通常影响力最小。

examples.en: The new coach quickly changed the team’s pecking order.
examples.zh: 新教练很快改变了球队内部的排位。

extraExplanation: “pecking order（等级序列/排位）”源自对鸡群等家禽行为的观察：地位高的会啄地位低的，低位者往往不敢反击，于是形成稳定的“谁压谁”的顺序。后来这个说法被广泛借用来描述职场、学校、团体中的权力与优先级。

summary.en: Peckish means “a little hungry,” often suggesting you want a small snack rather than a full meal.
summary.zh: Peckish 表示“有点饿”，通常暗示想吃点零食/点心，而不是正餐。

definition.en: A little hungry; wanting a small amount of food.
definition.zh: 有点饿；想吃点东西（但不算很饿）。

examples.en: I’m feeling a bit peckish—shall we grab a snack?
examples.zh: 我有点饿——我们去吃点零食好吗？

examples.en: She got peckish after the long meeting.
examples.zh: 开了很久的会之后，她有点饿了。

examples.en: If you’re peckish, there’s fruit in the kitchen.
examples.zh: 如果你有点饿，厨房里有水果。

extraExplanation: “peckish”在英式英语里很常用、语气轻松随意，表示“有点饿，想垫垫肚子”。在美式英语也能听懂，但更常说“a little hungry”或“kinda hungry”。
词源与“peck”（啄、啄食）有关，带有“像小鸟啄几口那样只想吃一点”的感觉，因此通常暗示只需要小吃/点心而不是一顿正餐。

summary.en: “Pecks” can mean small quick taps/kisses (plural nouns), dry-measure units (plural), or the verb form meaning “pecks” = “taps/picks with a beak.”
summary.zh: “pecks”既可作名词复数（轻啄/轻吻；或传统干量单位“配克”），也可作动词第三人称单数（轻啄、轻戳）。

definition.en: the plural of “peck”: a quick, light hit with the beak (by a bird), or a quick light kiss
definition.zh: “peck”的复数：指（鸟）用喙快速轻啄；也可指轻轻一吻

examples.en: The chicken gave the ground a few pecks and found a seed.
examples.zh: 那只鸡在地上啄了几下，找到了一粒种子。

examples.en: She greeted her child with two quick pecks on the cheek.
examples.zh: 她在孩子脸颊上轻轻亲了两下作为问候。

definition.en: the plural of “peck”: a unit for measuring dry goods (especially fruit/vegetables)
definition.zh: “peck”的复数：量词（主要用于干货，如水果、蔬菜）的“配克/斗”（英美传统单位）

examples.en: They bought two pecks of apples at the farm stand.
examples.zh: 他们在农场摊位买了两配克苹果。

definition.en: third-person singular of “peck”: to strike or pick at something repeatedly with a beak (or like a beak)
definition.zh: “peck”的第三人称单数：反复轻啄；（比喻）像鸟喙一样挑、戳、啄

examples.en: A sparrow pecks at the crumbs near the bench.
examples.zh: 一只麻雀在长椅旁啄食面包屑。

examples.en: He pecks at his keyboard with two fingers.
examples.zh: 他用两根手指在键盘上“戳着”打字。

extraExplanation: “peck”作单位时属于较传统的用法，日常口语里不如“pound/公斤”常见，但在农贸市场、乡村语境或固定表达里仍会出现。美制中 1 peck = 8 dry quarts（约 8.8 升）；英制历史上略有差异。
文化小知识：儿歌/谚语里常见 “a peck of pickled peppers”（绕口令）以及 “give someone a peck (on the cheek)”（轻轻一吻）。

summary.en: “pect” is a Latin root meaning “look/see,” usually appearing inside words (often as -pect- or -spect-).
summary.zh: “pect” 是表示“看/观察”的拉丁语词根，通常以 -pect- 或 -spect- 的形式出现在单词中。

definition.en: A Latin root (not usually a standalone English word) meaning “to look” or “to see,” found in many English words.
definition.zh: 一个拉丁语词根（通常不单独作为英语单词使用），意思是“看/观察”，常见于许多英语单词中。

examples.en: inspect = in- (“into”) + -spect- (“look”) → to look into something carefully.
examples.zh: inspect = in-（“向内”）+ -spect-（“看”）→ “仔细检查”。

examples.en: suspect = sub- (“under”) + -spect- (“look”) → to look at someone/something with doubt.
examples.zh: suspect = sub-（“在下/隐含”）+ -spect-（“看”）→ “怀疑；疑犯/嫌疑人”。

examples.en: spectator = -spect- (“look”) + -ator (“person”) → a person who watches.
examples.zh: spectator = -spect-（“看”）+ -ator（“人”）→ “观众”。

definition.en: A spelling variant you may see inside words as -pect-, closely related to -spect- (same root idea: “look/see”).
definition.zh: 你可能在一些单词内部看到的拼写形式 -pect-，与 -spect- 关系很近（同源、核心意思同为“看/观察”）。

examples.en: expect originally meant “to look out for” → now commonly “to think something will happen.”
examples.zh: expect 原义接近“盼望/等待（将要看到）”，现代常用义是“期待；认为会发生”。

examples.en: respect is related to “look back/again” → to treat someone with honor and care.
examples.zh: respect 与“回头再看/重新看待”有关 → “尊重；敬重”。

examples.en: perspective relates to “looking through” → a way of seeing or thinking about something.
examples.zh: perspective 与“透过……去看”有关 → “观点；视角”。

extraExplanation: “-pect/-spect-”来自拉丁语 specere（看、观察）。英语里常见两种形态：-spect-（更直观，如 inspect, spectator, spectacle）和 -pect-（常出现在 expect, respect 等词里）。
学习这个词根时，可以把它当作“看”的线索：遇到生词时，先抓住词根 -pect/-spect-，再结合前缀（如 in-, sub-, re-, per-）来猜意思。

summary.en: “Peculate” means to embezzle or steal money you are trusted to handle, often in an official or legal context.
summary.zh: “peculate”指侵吞/挪用受托管理的钱，常见于正式或法律语境，尤其涉及公款。

definition.en: to steal money (especially public money or money you are trusted to manage); to embezzle
definition.zh: 侵吞（尤指公款或受托管理的钱）；挪用公款

examples.en: The accountant was arrested for peculating company funds.
examples.zh: 那名会计因侵吞公司资金被逮捕。

examples.en: Several officials were accused of peculating from the public budget.
examples.zh: 几名官员被指控从公共预算中侵吞资金。

extraExplanation: “peculate”较正式、偏法律语境，日常英语里更常用“embezzle（挪用/侵吞）”或“steal（偷）”。
词源来自拉丁语“peculatus”（侵吞公款），与“pecuniary（钱财的）”同源；更早可追溯到“pecu-（牲畜）”，反映古代财富常以牲畜计量。

summary.en: Peculi- is a root meaning “one’s own/private property,” behind words like peculiar and pecuniary.
summary.zh: peculi- 是表示“自己的/私有财产”的词根，见于 peculiar、pecuniary 等词。

definition.en: a word root/forming element meaning “one’s own; private property,” seen in words like peculiar and pecuniary
definition.zh: 词根/构词成分，意为“自己的；私有财产”，常见于 peculiar（古怪的/独特的）和 pecuniary（钱财的）等词

examples.en: Her style is peculiar—very much her own.
examples.zh: 她的风格很 peculiar——非常有她自己的特色。

examples.en: The report focused on pecuniary losses (money-related losses).
examples.zh: 报告重点讨论了 pecuniary losses（与金钱有关的损失）。

extraExplanation: “peculi-”来自拉丁语 peculium，原意是“个人的财产/私产”（尤其指在家庭或古罗马制度下，个人可支配的一部分财物）。再往前可追溯到 pecus（牲畜），因为在早期社会里“牲畜”常是财富的重要形式。
因此 peculiar 最早的意思更接近“属于某个人的、私有的、独有的”，后来语义逐渐发展为“与众不同的、特别的”，再到现代常见的“古怪的”。

summary.en: Peculia is a historical term (from Roman law) meaning a private fund managed by a dependent, though legally controlled by the household head.
summary.zh: Peculia 是罗马法背景下的历史用语，指家属（尤指奴隶）可自行管理但法律上仍受家长控制的“私产/私蓄”。

definition.en: (Historical, Roman law) Private property or a personal fund that legally belonged to the head of a household but was managed/used by a dependent (especially a slave or son).
definition.zh: （历史用语，罗马法）“私产/私蓄”：法律上归家长所有，但允许被家长支配的家属（尤指奴隶或儿子）自行管理和使用的一笔财产/资金。

examples.en: In Roman society, some slaves could build up peculia and sometimes buy their freedom.
examples.zh: 在罗马社会里，一些奴隶可以积累 peculia，甚至有时用来赎身获得自由。

examples.en: The contract says any earnings will go into the worker’s peculia, though the master still has legal control.
examples.zh: 合同规定收入会进入这名劳工的 peculia，但主人仍拥有法律控制权。

extraExplanation: “peculia”来自拉丁语，常被视为 peculium 的复数形式（peculium → peculia）。在英文历史写作中，你可能会看到 peculium（单数）更常用。
它和常见英语词 peculiar（“奇怪的；特有的”）同源：都来自拉丁语里“私人财产/个人的东西”的概念，后来引申为“属于某人的、特有的”，再进一步引申为“与众不同、显得奇怪的”。

summary.en: Peculiar means either “strange/unusual” or “unique to a particular person or place,” depending on context.
summary.zh: peculiar 可表示“奇怪/不寻常”，也可表示“某人或某地特有的”，具体看语境。

definition.en: Strange or unusual, especially in a way that makes you notice it.
definition.zh: 奇怪的；不寻常的（尤指引人注意的）。

examples.en: There’s a peculiar smell in the kitchen.
examples.zh: 厨房里有一股奇怪的味道。

examples.en: He had a peculiar way of laughing that everyone remembered.
examples.zh: 他的笑声方式很特别，大家都记得。

definition.en: Belonging only to one person, group, or thing; particular to them.
definition.zh: 特有的；独有的（只属于某人/某群体/某事物的）。

examples.en: This custom is peculiar to that region.
examples.zh: 这个习俗是那个地区特有的。

examples.en: Each writer has a style peculiar to their own voice.
examples.zh: 每位作家都有一种属于自己声音的独特风格。

extraExplanation: “peculiar”既可以是中性的“特别/独特”，也常带一点“怪怪的/不太正常”的感觉，语气比“unusual”更主观、更容易让人联想到“怪”。在正式写作里，“peculiar to …”很常见，意思是“……所特有的”。
词源来自拉丁语 *peculiaris*，原意与“个人财产/私有物”有关，因此引申出“某人（或某地）独有的”。在文学里，作家常用它来营造一种“细微的不安或异样感”，比如描写“a peculiar silence（古怪的寂静）”。

summary.en: Peculiarities means unusual or distinctive features, or (especially about people) small odd habits.
summary.zh: peculiarities 指不寻常或独特的特征；也可指（尤指人）的小怪癖、古怪习惯。

definition.en: Special or unusual features or characteristics that make someone or something different from others.
definition.zh: （某人或某物的）特殊之处；独特或不寻常的特征。

examples.en: Every culture has its own peculiarities in food and greetings.
examples.zh: 每种文化在饮食和问候方式上都有自己的独特之处。

examples.en: The report mentions the peculiarities of the local climate.
examples.zh: 报告提到了当地气候的特殊特点。

definition.en: Strange or slightly odd habits or behaviors (often used when talking about people).
definition.zh: （常指人的）怪癖；有点古怪的习惯或行为。

examples.en: His peculiarities include labeling everything in the kitchen.
examples.zh: 他的怪癖包括给厨房里所有东西贴标签。

examples.en: We all have our little peculiarities, and that’s okay.
examples.zh: 我们每个人都有一些小怪癖，这很正常。

extraExplanation: “peculiarities”是复数形式，单数是“peculiarity”。日常写作里常用搭配有：the peculiarities of a system/culture/language（某个系统/文化/语言的特殊之处）。
语气上，“peculiarity”可以是中性（特点、特色），也可以略带委婉的负面（古怪、怪癖）。如果想更中性，可以用“quirks”（小特点/小怪癖，口语更轻松）或“distinctive features”（更正式、更中性）。

summary.en: Peculiarity means a distinctive or unusual feature, often a small quirk, or the quality of being unique to someone or something.
summary.zh: Peculiarity 指某人或某事物的独特/不寻常之处（常带“小怪癖”的感觉），也可指“特有性、独有性”。

definition.en: A special, unusual, or distinctive feature of a person, thing, or situation.
definition.zh: （人、事物或情况的）特性；特别之处；古怪之处。

examples.en: One peculiarity of this old house is that every door is a different size.
examples.zh: 这栋老房子有个特别之处：每扇门的尺寸都不一样。

examples.en: His main peculiarity is that he always drinks tea with lemon, never with milk.
examples.zh: 他最明显的一个习惯/特点是：喝茶一定加柠檬，从不加牛奶。

examples.en: The report noted a peculiarity in the data that needed further investigation.
examples.zh: 报告指出数据中有一个异常之处，需要进一步调查。

definition.en: The state of being particular to one person, group, place, or thing; uniqueness.
definition.zh: 特有性；独有性；（某地、某群体等的）特征。

examples.en: The peculiarity of the local dialect can be hard for outsiders to understand.
examples.zh: 这种地方方言的独特性，对外地人来说可能很难理解。

examples.en: Researchers are interested in the peculiarity of this species’ behavior.
examples.zh: 研究人员对这种物种行为的独有性很感兴趣。

extraExplanation: “peculiarity”常带有“有点怪/不寻常”的语感，但不一定是贬义；既可以指可爱的“小怪癖”，也可以指需要注意的“异常点”。
词源上与拉丁语“peculium”（私有财产）有关，因此早期含义偏“属于某人的、特有的”，后来才常用来指“与众不同的特点/怪处”。

summary.en: Peculiarize means to make something distinctive or unusual, or to set it apart as unique.
summary.zh: peculiarize 指使某物变得独特或奇特，或把它区分出来使其显得与众不同。

definition.en: to make something peculiar (special, distinctive, or unusual); to give it a unique character
definition.zh: 使……变得独特/特殊/怪异；使……具有独一无二的特征

examples.en: Certain customs peculiarize the festival in that region.
examples.zh: 某些习俗使那个地区的节日显得格外独特。

examples.en: The writer uses local dialect to peculiarize the narrator’s voice.
examples.zh: 作者用地方方言来使叙述者的声音更具独特性。

definition.en: to distinguish or set apart as unique
definition.zh: 将……区分开来；使……与众不同

examples.en: What peculiarizes this species is its ability to survive long droughts.
examples.zh: 使这种物种与众不同的是它能在长期干旱中存活。

examples.en: A single detail can peculiarize a character in a story.
examples.zh: 一个细节就能让故事里的角色显得与众不同。

extraExplanation: “peculiarize”由“peculiar（独特的/奇特的）+ -ize（使……化）”构成，属于较少见、偏书面/旧式的动词。现代英语里更常用“make … distinctive/unique”或“distinguish”。在文学评论或较正式的写作中偶尔会见到。

summary.en: Peculiarly means “in a strange/unusual way” or “especially/particularly,” depending on context.
summary.zh: peculiarly 表示“异常/不寻常地”，也可表示“尤其/特别地”，具体看语境。

definition.en: In a strange or unusual way; in a way that makes something stand out as different.
definition.zh: 以奇怪或不寻常的方式；以显得与众不同的方式。

examples.en: She was peculiarly quiet during the meeting.
examples.zh: 她在会议上异常安静。

examples.en: The town is peculiarly charming in winter.
examples.zh: 这个小镇在冬天有一种特别的迷人之处。

definition.en: Especially; particularly (often used to emphasize one thing among others).
definition.zh: 尤其；特别（常用于强调众多事物中的某一点）。

examples.en: He is peculiarly interested in classical music.
examples.zh: 他对古典音乐尤其感兴趣。

examples.en: This rule applies peculiarly to new employees.
examples.zh: 这条规定特别适用于新员工。

extraExplanation: “peculiarly”来自形容词“peculiar”。“peculiar”早期含义与拉丁语“peculium”（私产、个人财产）有关，因此在较正式语境里还可能带有“某人/某地特有的、专属的”意味，例如：a custom peculiar to the region（这个地区特有的习俗）。现代口语中更常见的是“奇怪的/不寻常的”。
语气提示：说人“peculiar”有时会显得不太客气（暗示“怪”），用“peculiarly”修饰行为/气氛通常更委婉：peculiarly quiet（异常安静）比 “She is peculiar.”（她很怪）更自然。

summary.en: A peculium is money or property someone is allowed to manage for personal use, especially in Roman law (slave/child), even though it legally belongs to the master or father.
summary.zh: peculium 指一笔允许个人管理使用的财产，尤指罗马法中主人给奴隶或父亲给子女管理的“私用财产”，但法律所有权仍归主人或父亲。

definition.en: (Historical, Roman law) Money or property that a master allowed a slave (or a father allowed a child) to manage personally, though it legally remained under the master’s (or father’s) control.
definition.zh: （历史用语，罗马法）主人允许奴隶（或父亲允许子女）自行管理的一笔钱或财产；法律上仍归主人（或父亲）所有。

examples.en: In Roman society, a slave might save a peculium to buy freedom.
examples.zh: 在罗马社会，奴隶可能会积攒一份 peculium 来赎身获得自由。

examples.en: The contract mentioned the servant’s peculium, even though it was not fully his property by law.
examples.zh: 合同里提到仆人的 peculium，尽管依法它并不完全属于他。

definition.en: (Law, broader) A fund or property set aside for someone who is under another person’s authority, especially when they may use it but do not fully own it.
definition.zh: （法律，广义）为受他人支配的人预留的一笔资金或财产；通常可使用但不完全拥有。

examples.en: The court treated the account as a peculium managed by the dependent party.
examples.zh: 法院将该账户视为由受支配一方管理的 peculium。

examples.en: Some legal writers compare a minor’s controlled assets to a kind of peculium.
examples.zh: 一些法学作者把未成年人受控制的资产类比为一种 peculium。

extraExplanation: 词源来自拉丁语 *peculium*，与 *pecus*（牲畜、财产）有关；在早期社会里“财富”常与牲畜数量相关，因此这个词带有“私房钱/私产”但“名义不完全归你”的制度色彩。
在罗马法语境中，*peculium* 很关键：它让奴隶/家属能进行一定的经济活动（做生意、积蓄），但最终所有权仍在家主（*paterfamilias*）或主人手里。阅读历史、法学或古典文学研究文章时更常见。

summary.en: Pecuniary means “related to money,” especially in formal, legal, or business contexts.
summary.zh: pecuniary 指“与金钱有关的”，多用于正式、法律或商业语境。

definition.en: Relating to money or finances; involving payment or financial value.
definition.zh: 与金钱或财务有关的；涉及付款或经济价值的。

examples.en: The company offered a pecuniary bonus for meeting the sales target.
examples.zh: 公司为达成销售目标提供了金钱奖金。

examples.en: He faced pecuniary difficulties after losing his job.
examples.zh: 失业后他遇到了经济困难。

examples.en: The court awarded pecuniary damages to cover medical expenses.
examples.zh: 法院判给财产性赔偿以支付医疗费用。

extraExplanation: “pecuniary”是偏正式/法律与商业语境常用词，比起日常的“financial”更书面，常见搭配有：pecuniary loss（金钱损失）、pecuniary damages（财产性/金钱赔偿）、pecuniary interest（金钱利益）。
词源来自拉丁语“pecunia”（钱财），与“pecus”（牲畜）有关：在古代社会里，牲畜常被视作财富，因此这个词带有“财富=可计价的财产”的历史痕迹。

summary.en: “Ped” is a short form that most commonly means a pediatrician or a pedestrian; in some contexts it can also mean a child (old-fashioned British), and it can be an offensive slang abbreviation for “pedophile.”
summary.zh: “ped”常见是“儿科医生”或“行人”的缩写；某些语境下也可指“小孩”（偏旧的英式用法）；同时它也可能是“pedophile”的冒犯性俚语缩写。

definition.en: a short form for “pediatrician” (a children’s doctor).
definition.zh: “pediatrician（儿科医生）”的缩写。

examples.en: We took our baby to the ped for a checkup.
examples.zh: 我们带宝宝去看儿科做体检。

examples.en: Call the ped if the fever doesn’t go down.
examples.zh: 如果退不了烧，就给儿科医生打电话。

definition.en: a short form for “pedestrian” (a person walking, not in a vehicle).
definition.zh: “pedestrian（行人）”的缩写。

examples.en: Ped crossing ahead—slow down.
examples.zh: 前方行人过街——减速。

examples.en: The report counted cars, bikes, and peds.
examples.zh: 报告统计了汽车、自行车和行人数量。

definition.en: a child (informal, mainly British; old-fashioned).
definition.zh: 小孩（非正式，主要英式；偏旧用法）。

examples.en: When I was a ped, I loved comic books.
examples.zh: 我小时候很爱看漫画书。

definition.en: a shortened form of “pedophile” (OFFENSIVE slang; avoid in polite conversation).
definition.zh: “pedophile（恋童者）”的缩写（带冒犯性的俚语；正式/礼貌场合应避免）。

examples.en: Online, people sometimes use “ped” as a harmful insult.
examples.zh: 在网上，人们有时把“ped”当成带伤害性的辱骂用语。

extraExplanation: “ped”在不同国家/语境里含义差异很大：在美式日常中最常见的是儿科医生（pediatrician）的口语缩写；在道路标识、交通工程或报告中也常指行人（pedestrian）。
需要注意：在网络语境中，“ped”有时被用作“pedophile”的缩写或辱骂，这个用法非常敏感且具攻击性；如果想表达严肃含义，建议直接使用更正式的词（如“pediatrician / pedestrian”），避免误解。

summary.en: “Ped” is an informal abbreviation that can mean a children’s doctor (pediatrician) or, in other contexts, a derogatory short form of “pedophile.” It can also mean “to pedal.”
summary.zh: “ped”是非正式缩写：可指“儿科医生（pediatrician）”，也可能在其他语境中作为“pedophile（恋童癖者）”的贬义简称；还可表示“踩踏板骑行”。

definition.en: (informal, sometimes offensive) Short for “pedophile”; a person who is sexually attracted to children.
definition.zh: （非正式，有时具冒犯性）“pedophile（恋童癖者）”的缩写；指对儿童有性欲吸引的人。

examples.en: The police said they were investigating an alleged ped.
examples.zh: 警方表示正在调查一名被指控的“ped（恋童癖者）”。

examples.en: Be careful with this word—it's a harsh label and can be defamatory if used loosely.
examples.zh: 使用这个词要非常谨慎——它是很重的标签，随意使用可能构成诽谤。

definition.en: (informal, chiefly UK/Ireland) Short for “pediatrician/paediatrician”; a children's doctor.
definition.zh: （非正式，主要英/爱尔兰）“pediatrician/paediatrician（儿科医生）”的简称。

examples.en: We took our daughter to the ped for a checkup.
examples.zh: 我们带女儿去看儿科医生做体检。

definition.en: (informal) Short for “pedal,” meaning to use pedals to move a bicycle.
definition.zh: （非正式）“pedal（踩踏板）”的简写；指踩踏板骑行。

examples.en: I ped home after work to save money.
examples.zh: 下班后我骑车（踩踏板）回家省钱。

extraExplanation: “ped”在英语里含义差异很大：在一些语境中是“儿科医生/儿科”的口语简称，但在另一些语境中常被理解为“pedophile”的缩写，带有强烈贬义，且可能引发法律风险（例如不当指控）。写作或公开场合建议用完整词（pediatrician 或 pedophile）以避免误解。
在美式英语中，说“儿科医生”更常用 pediatrics / pediatrician；“ped”更常见于口语、短信或某些地区用法。

summary.en: Pedagogic means ‘related to teaching’ and can also imply ‘somewhat preachy or overly instructional.’
summary.zh: pedagogic 表示“与教学有关的”，也可指“有点说教、过于强调教学目的的”。

definition.en: Related to teaching or education; intended to help people learn.
definition.zh: 与教学或教育有关的；旨在帮助学习的。

examples.en: The book has a clear, pedagogic style with lots of examples.
examples.zh: 这本书的教学风格很清晰，还有很多例子。

examples.en: Some videos are entertaining, but this one is more pedagogic.
examples.zh: 有些视频偏娱乐，但这个更偏教学。

definition.en: Teaching in a way that focuses more on instruction than on entertainment or art (sometimes used critically).
definition.zh: （有时带批评意味）偏重说教、强调教学目的而不够自然或有趣的。

examples.en: The lecture felt a bit pedagogic and hard to stay engaged with.
examples.zh: 这场讲座有点说教味，比较难保持专注。

examples.en: The film’s message is strong, but the ending is too pedagogic for some viewers.
examples.zh: 这部电影的主题很明确，但对一些观众来说结尾太说教了。

extraExplanation: “pedagogic”与“pedagogical”意思基本相同；在现代英语里，“pedagogical”更常见一些，但两者都正式、偏学术。
词根来自希腊语：paid-（孩子）+ agogos（引导者），原意是“引导孩子的人”，后来引申为“教学/教育”。
在教育语境中常与“methods/approach/style”搭配：pedagogic methods（教学方法）、pedagogic approach（教学理念/途径）。

summary.en: Pedagogical means “related to teaching and learning methods,” and sometimes describes a slightly “lecture-like” or “preachy” tone.
summary.zh: Pedagogical 指“与教学/学习方法有关的”，有时也可形容语气“像讲课一样、略带说教”。

definition.en: Related to teaching methods or the practice of education; intended to help people learn.
definition.zh: 与教学方法或教育实践有关的；旨在帮助学习的。

examples.en: The course has a strong pedagogical focus, with lots of practice and feedback.
examples.zh: 这门课程很强调教学法，有大量练习和反馈。

examples.en: The teacher chose a pedagogical approach that supports different learning styles.
examples.zh: 老师选择了一种能支持不同学习风格的教学方法。

definition.en: (Less common) Used to describe someone who teaches in a way that feels overly instructive or like a lecture.
definition.zh: （较不常见）形容某人说教式的、过于像上课或讲道理的。

examples.en: His tone became a bit pedagogical, as if he were addressing a classroom.
examples.zh: 他的语气有点说教，仿佛在对着教室讲话。

extraExplanation: 词源来自希腊语：paid-（孩子）+ agogos（引导者），原意接近“带领孩子学习的人”。因此它常出现在教育学、课程设计、教学法（teaching methods）等语境中。
常见搭配：pedagogical approach（教学方法/教学取向），pedagogical methods（教学方法），pedagogical value（教学价值），pedagogical tool（教学工具）。
相关词：pedagogy（n. 教学法/教育学）；pedagogue（n. 教师；也可带贬义“迂腐的说教者”）。
在学术写作里，pedagogical 通常是中性词（强调“有助于学习”）；在日常对话里，用来形容人时可能带一点“爱说教”的语气。

summary.en: A pedagogue is a teacher, often with a negative sense: strict, overly formal, and focused on rules.
summary.zh: pedagogue 指“教师”，但常带贬义：刻板、过分形式化、强调规矩与说教。

definition.en: A teacher, especially one who is strict or overly focused on rules and formal instruction.
definition.zh: 教师；（尤指）拘泥刻板、过分强调规矩与形式教学的人。

examples.en: Some students thought he was a pedagogue because he cared more about grammar rules than communication.
examples.zh: 有些学生觉得他很“刻板的老师”，因为他更在意语法规则而不是交流。

examples.en: She’s knowledgeable, but she can sound like a pedagogue when she corrects every small mistake.
examples.zh: 她很有学问，但当她纠正每一个小错误时，听起来会有点像“迂腐的老师”。

extraExplanation: “pedagogue”在现代英语里常带一点负面或讽刺意味，强调“死板、爱说教、重形式轻理解”。如果只是中性地说“教育者/教师”，更常用 teacher / educator / instructor。
词源来自希腊语 paidagōgos，原意接近“带领孩子的人”（在古代常指陪伴、照看并督导孩子的仆人或监护者），后来引申为“教导者”。

summary.en: Pedagogy means the study and practice of teaching, or a specific approach to teaching.
summary.zh: Pedagogy 指“教育学/教学法”，也可指某种具体的教学理念或教学风格。

definition.en: The study and practice of teaching: how to teach effectively, including methods, goals, and how students learn.
definition.zh: 教育学；教学法：研究并实践如何有效教学，包括教学方法、目标以及学生如何学习。

examples.en: Her pedagogy focuses on discussion and critical thinking.
examples.zh: 她的教学法强调讨论和批判性思维。

examples.en: The school invests in teacher training and modern pedagogy.
examples.zh: 学校投入教师培训和现代教育学。

definition.en: A particular teacher’s or school’s approach or style of teaching.
definition.zh: （某位教师或学校的）教学理念/教学风格。

examples.en: His pedagogy is strict but supportive.
examples.zh: 他的教学风格严格但很支持学生。

examples.en: Their pedagogy emphasizes project-based learning.
examples.zh: 他们的教学理念强调项目式学习。

extraExplanation: “pedagogy”源自希腊语，原意与“引导孩子学习的人”有关，所以它常带有“教学理念、引导学习方式”的含义，而不只是“教书”这一个动作。
学习中常见搭配：effective pedagogy（有效教学法）, teaching pedagogy（教学法）, pedagogy of + 学科（如 pedagogy of math 数学教学法）。
易混词区分：pedagogy 更偏“教学方法/理念”；education 更广，指“教育”整体；curriculum 指“课程体系/课程内容”。

summary.en: “Pedal” is usually a foot-operated part on a bike/car/piano, or the action of pushing those pedals to ride a bicycle.
summary.zh: “pedal”常指自行车/汽车/钢琴上的脚踏板，也可作动词表示“踩踏板骑行（蹬车）”。

definition.en: a foot-operated lever used to control a machine, especially on a bicycle, piano, or car
definition.zh: 踏板；脚踏（用脚操作的杠杆装置），常见于自行车、钢琴或汽车等

examples.en: Press the brake pedal slowly.
examples.zh: 慢慢踩下刹车踏板。

examples.en: The bicycle pedal came loose while I was riding.
examples.zh: 我骑车时自行车踏板松了。

definition.en: to move a bicycle by pushing the pedals with your feet
definition.zh: 踩踏板骑行；蹬（自行车）

examples.en: She pedaled up the hill without stopping.
examples.zh: 她不停地蹬车上了山。

examples.en: If you pedal faster, you’ll get there sooner.
examples.zh: 你蹬得更快，就会更早到。

extraExplanation: 易混淆点：pedal（踏板/踩踏）不要和 peddle（叫卖/兜售）或 petal（花瓣）混淆。它们发音相近但意思完全不同。
常见搭配：brake pedal（刹车踏板）、gas/accelerator pedal（油门踏板）、pedal a bike（骑自行车/蹬车）、pedal harder/faster（更用力/更快地蹬）。
在音乐里：piano pedals（钢琴踏板）常见有 damper/sustain pedal（延音踏板），用来延长音的共鸣。

summary.en: “Pedaled” means you pushed pedals with your feet (most often on a bicycle).
summary.zh: “Pedaled”表示你用脚踩踏板（最常见指骑自行车）。

definition.en: Past tense and past participle of “pedal”; to push the pedals of a bicycle (or similar vehicle) with your feet to make it move.
definition.zh: “pedal”的过去式和过去分词；（用脚）踩踏板使自行车等前进。

examples.en: She pedaled uphill for ten minutes without stopping.
examples.zh: 她不停地踩着踏板上坡骑了十分钟。

examples.en: We pedaled along the river and enjoyed the view.
examples.zh: 我们沿着河边骑车，欣赏风景。

definition.en: To operate a pedal with your foot (for example, a sewing machine or a car pedal).
definition.zh: 用脚操作踏板（例如缝纫机踏板或汽车踏板）。

examples.en: He pedaled the machine slowly to keep the stitching even.
examples.zh: 他慢慢踩踏板，让缝线更均匀。

examples.en: She pedaled gently to avoid a sudden start.
examples.zh: 她轻踩踏板，避免突然起步。
